Gilbert is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Okamafo Jesus’ which literary means 'Jesus is our spokesperson'. He is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of cassava and plantains

loans.name: Nyame Ye Odo Group

texts.en:
The group leader is Beatrice.  Beatrice is 45 years old, divorced, and the mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She has been a food vendor for eight years. She prepares and sells apoti in her neighborhood. Apoti is prepared by pounding ripe plantain and mixing it with flour. It is enjoyed by most Ghanaians as an appetizer. She requests a loan that will be used to buy supplies in bulk, such as ripe plantains, flour, and vegetable oil. She will thus be able to prepare apoti in bulk. With the loan she will increase her earnings to save more for the educational needs of her children.  

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame ye odo’ which literally means God is love. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members commit to each other as social collateral to access the loan and apply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy ripe plantains, flour, maize etc.	in bulk

loans.name: Asomdwehene 1 Group

texts.en:
Rita is 32 years old and the group leader. She is married and the mother of three kids. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, which are cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey at breakfast, lunch, and supper. In addition, she also sells raw food, such as bags of maize, at the market square. She has been selling kenkey for ten years now. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children - especially in their education. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Asomdwehene 1’ which literally means 'prince of peace.' She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to access the loan and apply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. is 39 years old and married to Bartonjo Kiptala who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children. Monica has a poultry business which is located in Sertwet at Kiptala Bartonjo farm within Eldoret Town. Monica practices poultry farming with a local breed of chicken and sells her eggs to Kipchamo Primary Boarding School. She has been in the poultry business for the past six years now. Monica was introduced to KADET by a neighbour who is already a client with KADET. With this loan from KADET, she intends to buy more broiler chickens and to improve the roofing on the poultry house. In future, Monica intends to diversify and grow her business; she wants to rear more broiler chickens for meat, and begin large-scale manure production. Monica hopes that the profit from her business will allow her to pay for a university or college education for her children. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more broiler chickens, and iron sheeting to improve the roofing on the poultry house

loans.name: Asomdwehene 2 Group

texts.en:
Angelina is 29 years old and the group leader. She is a divorced mother with four children. Currently all her children attend school in the community where they live. She sells smoked fish and started in this business six years ago at the local community market. She buys stock from Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She serves her customers very tasty and high quality fish and, because of the quality, many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fishmongers occasionally, when demand is high. She has a large customer base as a result of her moderate prices and her pleasant disposition towards her customers. She is requesting a loan to upgrade her stock of fishes. She aspires to give her children quality education through the proceeds from the business and she would be grateful for your support.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Asomdwehene 2’ which literary means 'prince of peace.' She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to access the loan and apply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To upgrade her stock of fishes.

loans.name: Angélique

texts.fr: Angélique S. est une femme mariée de 46 ans. Elle fait un élevage de volaille afin de revendre. Ce prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son capital et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Angélique S. is 46 years old and married. She raises poultry for resale. This loan will enable her to bolster her working capital, and to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise poultry for resale

loans.name: Adom Nyame Group

texts.en:
Akua is 32 years old. She is a married woman with one daughter who is currently in school. She prepares and sells pastries like cake, doughnuts, flour chips etc. through hawking and she also supplies them to shops around her. She manages to meet her customers' demand by depending on the meager resources she has saved. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers.

Akua's only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet the demands of her customers. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide support for the business. She has been in business for four years now.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Adom Nyame’ which literary means 'God’s grace'. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: hawa D. confectionne et vend des thioubs.elle habite ouakam depuis dix ans,elle a une tres grande experience en teinture mais elle confectionne aussi des robes en batik.elle est divorcee et mere de deux enfants.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs en vue d'augmenter son fond de roulement et augmenter ses benefices en vue de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Hawa D. makes and sells "thioubs" (dyed fabrics). She's been living in Ouakam for ten years, and is very experienced in dying. She also makes batik dresses. She's divorced and the mother of two children. She's seeking a loan of XOF 150'000, in view of bolstering her working capital, in order to increase her revenue to better provide for her small family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of five children who are all in school. She is a petty trader and sells smoked meat. She gets her stocks from Tamale in the northern part of Ghana. She buys in bulk and supplies to food vendors in the community market where she lives.

In most cases, people place their order in advanced and she supplies to them as soon as she arrives. She started her business two years ago with lots of experience and the atmosphere of creating a good environment. She requests the loan to trek to the north of Ghana to buy stock. She also dreams of providing education for her children from the business proceeds.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 28 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. One is schooling and her last-born is breastfeeding. She is a petty trader and trades in salt and bags of rice. She supplies them to food vendors, among others. She travels to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. She buys few bags of salt and rice because she does not have enough money to buy more. This makes her travel frequently to Kumasi, because her capital is not sufficient to buy in bulk.

Philomena spoke to her husband and to some family members for financial assistance but to no avail. She is requesting the loan to buy bulk supplies of salt and bags of rice; this, she believes, will reduce the frequency of travel. She dreams of saving more to cater for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy bulk quantities of salt

loans.name: Som Nyame Yie Group

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Currently, all her children are in school. She has five boys and one girl and she is able to cater for them through the support of her husband who is a gold miner.

Cecilia owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. in the area where she lives. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers.

With her 22 years' experience, she wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children's education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Som Nyame Yie’ which literary means ‘serve God well’. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma S. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 59 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business providing motor cab for hire services to local community members. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (about $62 US) a month for these activities.

In 2006, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 pesos from PMPC. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos which will be used to purchase materials needed to repair the motor cab for better service. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the motor cab

loans.name: Pentecost Group

texts.en:
Ernestina is 45 years old. She is a divorced woman with three children. All her children are in school. She is a baker who has been using flour for her production for 20 years now. She bakes bread and retails it to her customers. She supplies it by herself in the market center to her customers and people also take bulk delivery of bread from her.

Ernestina's only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Pentecost’. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 35 years old. She is married and mother of three children. Two are schooling whilst her first is working as a trader. She is a petty trader and sells pork in the community market where she lives. She takes delivery of goods from Kumasi central market in bulk and supplies them to her loyal customers. She is constrained by funds and finds it difficult to make enough profit, making it hard to take care of her household. She requests the loan to buy a bulk supply of pork to increase her stock. She works hard to help her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of pork

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza E. is from the town of Aloran. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Three are currently in school. She is a petty trader and sells assorted products like cooking utensils and through hawking, that is, house-to-house selling. She has been in this business for two years now. With her humorous nature, she has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her.

Akosua treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of the high increase in the price of goods in the market. She requests a loan to buy more supplies of the products like cooking utensils. With the loan she hopes to make lots of profit and to build a store to reduce the frequent walking in the street to sell her wares. She wants to save more for her children's education.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cooking utensils, fabrics, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is resourceful and committed to the support of her family. Currently, her children attend school in the community where they live, while she works as a food seller who specializes in “Waakye”. Waakye is prepared from rice and beans and is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. She has been in this business for three years, but the price of raw materials has gone up significantly in recent months and she needs a loan to meet her production costs. She would be grateful to have your support.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children.

Cecilia owns and operates a business running a stall, primarily selling dried fish products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila G. is 48 years old and from the city of Dapitan. She is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lila owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lila has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lila joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a businesswoman who makes a living selling clothes, linen and lace. She sometimes sells by traveling about, hawking her wares. She is 33 years old, divorced and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She is committed to support her family by working hard. She has 15 years selling experience but has been hampered by insufficient funds. She is applying for this loan to revive her business and increase her profits. She wants to buy clothes, linen and lace in bulk to sell to her customers. Her overriding goal is to save more money so she can give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: To buuy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Glenita

texts.en: Mrs Glenita M. is 50 years old and lives in P1 Silanga, Tangub City. She is a widow and mother of two children. One of her children is now a member of the Philippine National Police (PNP) while the other is still in high school. To support her family, Glenita opened a small sari-sari (general) store in 2004 with a little capital. Now her business is still going well, and she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 PHP a month, enough to support her child in high school. She is now applying for a loan amount of 4,500 PHP to use as additional working capital. Her future dream is to expand her business from a sari-sari store to a grocery store and be able to send her child to college.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna A. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 23 years old. Lorna is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a sari-sari store (general store). The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Lorna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice N. est une dame de 47ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants avec 4 autres enfants dont elle a la charge.  Elle s’active dans le commerce de céréales, et tient en même temps une gargote où elle vend le petit déjeuner. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi de faire une embauche porcine à domicile. Ceci pour mieux participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice N., age 47, is married and the mother of 6 children, and has 4 other children to support. She sells cereals, and also runs a luncheonette where she sells breakfasts. This loan will also enable her to raise a pig at home, in order to better help with the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise a pig, sell cereals and sell breakfasts

loans.name: Mariana Isabel

texts.es:
Marianita vive en la ciudadela los Eucaliptos, un sector muy bonito dentro de la ciudad de Cuenca, no tiene casa propia por lo cual arrienda una las calles Tungurahua y Corregidor, cuenta que pertenece ya muchos años al banco comunal la Unión, dice que es un banco de personas responsables y serias, lo más importante es que son puntuales.
Es de 47 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos de 25, 22, 20 años, la mayoría de sus hijos viven con ella, solo la mayor vive aparte, pero dice que es solo un dicho ya que la mayor parte del tiempo pasa con Marianita, en especial sus nietos, cuenta que su hogar es tranquilo, todo es armonía y existe una buena relación con su pareja. 
Pertenece a al banco comunal la Unión ya mucho tiempo, tal es que este es el sexto préstamo que realiza, el de hoy que va a hacer es de 1100 dólares, que los invertirá incorporando productos y utensilios para su negocio que es un salón de comida en el mercado  12 de Abril de la ciudad de Cuenca, ella realiza comidas como secos de carne, pollo, guatita, jugos, M. en leche, y otros aperitivos que puede venderlos a las personas que llegan al mercado, la ventaja de este negocio es que por estar a la llegada (entrada) del mercado, la gente directamente va comiendo o tomándose un M. que sin ser ostentosa son los mejores del mercado.
texts.en:
Marianita lives in the Eucaliptos neighborhood, a very nice section of Cuenca. She does not own her own home but rents one on Tungurahua and Corregidor Streets. She has belonged to the "La Unión" community bank for many years and says that the members are responsible and serious, but most important of all, punctual. She is 47 years old, married and has three children who are 25, 22 and 20. Most of the children live with her, only the oldest lives apart, although he spends most of his time with Marianita along with her grandchildren. Her home is peaceful and harmonious and she has a good relationship with her husband. She has belonged to the "La Unión" community bank for a long time and this is her sixth loan. This loan will be for 1,100 dollars, which will be used for supplies and utensils for her business, which is a restaurant in the April 12th market in the city of Cuenca. She prepares meals such as beef stew, chicken, guatita (a tripe dish with potatoes and peanut sauce), juices, M. en leche (a drink similar in taste to rice pudding, but made with corn) and other dishes that she can sell to people who come to the market. The advantage of this business is that it is located at the entrance to the market and people come straight to her place to eat or have a M., which happens to be the best in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy utensils and supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Gloria Maxima

texts.es:
Señora Gloria vive en el barrio la Playa, es un barrio ubicado  en el sector rural Cruz del Camino en la Comunidad del Valle, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, su clima es bonito  y variado, las tierras son buenas para las siembras, cosechan maíz, fréjol, papas, verduras, no en gran cantidad porque la gente sale a la ciudad a trabajar, pero si para abastecer al sector, y para consumo propio de los dueños, además se dedican a la cría de animales como vacas, borregos, pollos, gansos, cuyes, y otros.
Gloria nació en el año de 1966, teniendo hasta hoy 43 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos, de 17,15 y 4 años de edad, las dos mayores trabajan pero la escuela si terminaron, Gloria cuenta que no sabe cuando mismo ha estado divorciada, porque hace 15 años su esposo se fue al extranjero, de allí no supo nada de el, se olvidó de su familia, al momento que Gloria fue a retirar las partidas de nacimiento se entera que ya esta separada, no entiende la razón en ese tiempo tenía solo a sus dos hijos, al pasar el tiempo más o menos unos 10 años, llega a saber del padre de sus hijos, a partir de ello por exigencias de sus hijos el comienza a ayudarles económicamente.
Vive en casa propia sus dos hijos mayores la ayudan económicamente ya que trabajan el uno en la construcción y la otra de empleada doméstica en la ciudad de cuenca.

Gloria se dedica al negocio de los animales asiste a las ferias de ganado que se realizan en diferentes lugares de la provincia del Azuay, como por ejemplo Paute, Girón, Azogues, y otros, los días que sale son a partir del miércoles y termina el domingo, los otros días se dedica a cuidar a su madre que es de 87 años y está enferma, cuida también a sus animales, y cultiva las tierras que tiene, se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos, y el ganado que le resta del negocio de las ferias, los domingos va a la feria libre a comercializar los animales pequeños, también los vende en casa según los pedidos.
Gloria está solicitando este crédito para invertir en el negocio  comprando más animales y alimento para los mismos, tiene actualmente unos 100 pollos runas(pollos criados con alimentos naturales), y unos 60 pollos criollos(pollos criados con balanceado).
Esta muy agradecida con la Fundación espoir porque le ayuda a su negocio, su meta es llegar a comprarse un carro para que su hijo le ayude a trabajar en su negocio y no tener que estar pagando transporte.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in the La Playa neighborhood, which is located in a rural area called Cruz del Camino in the community of Del Valle, 45 minutes from Cuenca. The climate is mild and the fields are good for raising crops. They raise corn, beans, potatoes and vegetable, not in large quantities because the residents go into the city to work, but enough to supply the area and for their own consumption. They also raise animals such as cows, sheep, chickens, geese, guinea pigs and others. Gloria was born in 1966. Today she is 43 years old, divorced and has 3 children, 17, 15, and 4 years old. The two oldest work but they completed their schooling. Gloria does not really know how long she has been divorced because 15 years ago her husband went to another country and she never heard from him again and he forgot about his family. When she went to get a copy of her children´s birth certificates she found out that she was separated but never knew why. At that time she had only her two children. After about 10 years, she heard from the father of her children and he began to help them financially after the childen demanded it. She lives in her own house and her two older children help her financially; one works in construction and the other works as a domestic employee in Cuenca. Gloria´s business is animals; she goes to the livestock fairs which are held in different towns in Azuay province, such as in Paute, Girón, Azogues and other places. She does this from Wednesday to Sunday. Other days she takes care of her 87-year-old mother who is ill. She also takes care of her animals and her fields. She raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, and on Sundays she takes the livestock that she still has left over after the fairs to the open market where small animals are sold. She also sells from her home, on request. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more animals and feed for the animals. She currently has 100 free-range chickens (chickens fed organically) and 60 chickens raised on feed. She is very grateful to the Fundación Espior because they help her business. Her goal is to be able to buy a car so that her son can help her with the business and not have to pay for transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock and feed for livestock

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou F. est une mariée, mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait un élevage porcin et du petit commerce de poisson sec et fumé. Elle aimerait renforcer cette activité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Codou F. is married and the mother of 5 children. She has a pork farm and also does some small business selling dried and smoked fish. She would like to increase her business in order to better provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her pig farm and selling dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Trinidad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Trinidad es un grupo muy lindo de señoras que viven en los cerros de la comunidad de Turi sector La Trinidad, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, El clima en este lugar es igual al de Cuenca. Se reúnen por la noche cada 2 semanas en un salón de un jardín en el patio de la iglesia de la comunidad.  La mayoría de las señoras se dedican a la crianza de animales y la agricultura. 
 
Por ejemplo, la señora Maria Zoila Dután  tiene 48 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos mayores, los cuales ya están casados con familias propias. Tiene además 3 nietos. La señora se dedica al cultivo de maíz, papas y verduras. Vende lo que produce en el Mercado 10 de Agosto de la ciudad de Cuenca, y además lo que produce le sirve para alimentar a su familia. También cría algunos animales, como cuyes, pollos, una vaca y un chancho. La señora dice que lleva “toda una vida” trabajando en eso, como sus papás también fueron agricultores. María  pidió 165 dólares para poder comprar pollos para criar, vale $4.50 cada par de pollitos. Maria Zoila ya lleva 3 ciclos con su banco comunal, y dice que el trabajo con la fundación es bonito. “A veces uno no puede sacar préstamo en el banco porque te piden muchos papeles.” Dice María, Su meta para el futuro es comprarse un terreno. 
 
La señora Blanca Aída Dután de 27 años, casada, y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad. Ella trabaja en la casa, ayudando su marido con su taller de carpintería, donde hace muebles para oficinas y puertas. Ellos llevan 10 años trabajando en eso. Trabajan por pedidos, y como ya llevan bastante tiempo en este rubro, ya tienen muchos clientes regulares. Doña Blanca está pidiendo un crédito de 330 dólares para poder comprar maderas para su taller, y también algunos materiales necesarios, como lijas, disolventes y macillas. Ella ya lleva 7 ciclos con el banco comunal, dice que entró porque tenía una necesidad urgente, después entró al grupo y solucionó esta necesidad, pero le gustó el trabajo y decidió seguir con el grupo. Dice que los préstamos le sirven porque le ayudan a salir de los apuros y para poder cubrir en tiempos de pérdidas.  

La señora Julia Angelita M. R. de 24 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 5 años, trabaja con su esposo en un negocio que tienen en su casa, se trata de una carpintería que realizan muebles de complemento para el hogar y la oficina, ya tiene tres años ejerciendo estas funciones, cuenta Julia que gracias a la profesión de su esposo ella también aprendió a trabajar, lo que lleva a tener un hogar organizado porque están todo el tiempo juntos y lo que trabajan es en función siempre de su hogar, lo bueno de este trabajo es que ellos disponen del tiempo para trabajar, sin límite de horas, pero por lo general el horario es de 7 AM a 7PM,  el único inconveniente es que por motivos de dinero no tienen un vehículo para trabajar transportando los muebles, y por otro lado es la distancia que les complica. 
Su crédito que solicita hoy es de 330 dólares que los invertirá comprando material de cómo lijas, pinturas, disolventes, madera a lo que avance el dinero.
La meta que tiene conjuntamente con su esposo es implementar su taller con materiales y maquinaria, así como contratar operarios para facilitar el trabajo.
En la foto se encuentran todas las socias y el Coordinador de la oficina de Espoir En Cuenca, el mismo que hacia una visita de control.
texts.en:
The Trinidad Communal Bank is a lovely group of women who live in the hills of the Turi community of La Trinidad District, about half an hour outside the city of Cuenca. The climate there is similar to that of Cuenca. They meet at night every 2 weeks in the garden room of a courtyard at the local community church. Most of the ladies are engaged in animal husbandry and agriculture.

For example, Sra. Maria Zoila Dután is a 48 year old and married. She has 2 grown children who are already married with families themselves, as well as 3 grandchildren. This woman is devoted to growing corn, potatoes and vegetables. She sells her produce at the “10 de Agosto” Market in the city of Cuenca. Her income helps to feed her family. In addition, she breeds animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, cows and pigs. She says that she has been working all her life and that her parents were also farmers. Maria requested $165 to purchase chickens to raise, which comes to $4.50 for each pair of chicks. She has participated with her communal bank on 3 previous loan cycles and that working with the Foundation has been wonderful. "Sometimes you cannot get a loan from the bank because they ask for so many papers,” says Maria. Her future goal is to buy a plot of land.

Sra. Blanca Aída Dután is 27 years old, married and has 2 children (ages 10 and 4). She works at home, helping her husband with his carpentry workshop where he makes office furniture and doors. They have been in this line of business for 10 years and have established many regular customers. Their items are produced upon request. Sra. Blanca is requesting $330 to buy wood for her shop and other necessary materials, such as sandpaper, solvents, and hammers. She has participated in 7 loan cycles with her communal bank. She said that she joined her group during an urgent time of need, but when that need was fulfilled, she liked the group so much she decided to continue. Sra. Blanca also indicated that the loans have helped her out in time of trouble to recover from losses.

Sra. Julia Angelita M. R. is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children (ages 6 and 5). She works with her husband in a home-based carpentry business. They make furniture for the home and the office, and have been doing so for three years. Sra. Julia credits her husband’s job for teaching her how to work. As a result, she has been able to keep their home organized since they are both constantly working. Their schedule is unlimited, but they try to keep their work hours between 7am and 7pm. The only setback is that they cannot afford a vehicle to transport furniture, which is difficult if they have a customer that lives some distance away from them. Sra. Julia is requesting $330 to purchase materials for her work such as sandpaper, paints, solvents and wood. Her goal is to have enough materials and machines so that she and her husband can hire employees to help with the work.

In the photograph are all the members with their loan officer at the ESPOIR office in Cuenca. This was taken on the day of their loan verification meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials such as sandpaper, solvents, paints and hammers.

loans.name: Dany

texts.fr: Dany M. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait l’élevage de porc et prévoit aussi de faire du petit commerce. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter les revenus du ménage.
texts.en:
Dany M., age 40, is married and the mother of six. She raises pigs and also foresees working in small scale commerce. This loan will enable her to bolster her business and to increase household revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising pigs and for small-scale commerce

loans.name: Regina Ana

texts.pt:
Regina Ana S. nasceu na província de Gaza (230 km a norte da cidade de Maputo), tem 38 anos de idade, mãe de 6 filhos dois dos quais são maiores de idade e todos freqüentam escola.
Regina estudou ate 4 classe na escola oficial de Gaza parou por causa da insuficiência financeira dos pais.

Vive com o seu marido, seus filhos e mais uma sobrinha sob sua responsabilidade.  Cresceu na companhia dos pais e mais tarde passou para cidade de maputo, no bairro de Chamanculo, com os seus tios onde conseguiu continuar com os estudos ate 6 classe. Aos 19 anos casou se e passou a viver noutro bairro vizinho (Inhagoia, arredores da cidade de Maputo). É neste bairro onde começou a interessar se em fazer pequenos negócios para aumentar a renda familiar.

Tem 3 anos de experiência na actividade que desenvolve, venda de roupa diversa, que aprendeu com suas amigas. 
Adquire a mercadoria (roupas) na cidade de Maputo e outra encomenda de áfrica do sul. Compra o fato para os homens a 790,00MT e revende a 1.300,00MT. e consegue um rendimento mensal no valor de 12.000,00MT.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições informações e teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos tendo aproximado para solicitar o credito no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra e venda de roupa diversa.

Espera ver o seu negocio a melhorar e angariar mais clientes assim como dar credito por espécie (entregar os fatos e cobrar em prestações por combinar) aos seus clientes.
Propõe se a pagar bem o seu credito para poder aceder a outros empréstimos, como forma de tornar os sonhos realizáveis.
texts.en:
Regina Ana S. was born in Gaza province (230 km north of Maputo city). She is 38 years old and the mother of 6 children. Regina finished the fourth grade at Gaza’s official school but stopped because her parents could not afford the costs. She lives with her husband, her children and a niece that she is raising. Regina was raised by her parents and later moved to the Chamanculo neighborhood in Maputo. In that neighborhood she became interested in some small jobs that increased her family income. She now has 3 years of experience in selling a variety of clothing. She learned this business with her friends. She buys the clothing in Maputo or from another South African company. She spends 79,00MT on an order and resells it for 1.300,00MT. She earns a monthly income of 12.000,00MT. She has never had a loan with another lending institution, and she learned about Hluvuku-Adsema from friends. She is asking for a loan of 20.000,00MT to buy more clothing to sell. Regina would like to improve her business and gain more clients (for example she would like to offer a system of credit and monthly payments for her clients). She pledges to repay her loan in order to continue working with lending institutions, so she can realize her dreams.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling clothes

loans.name: Eulalie

texts.fr: Eulalie N. est une dame de 70 ans, veuve. Elle veut ce prêt afin de renforcer son activité d’embauche porcine et de vente de boissons. Son objectif est d’augmenter ses revenus et d’avoir une autonomie financière dans ses activités.
texts.en:
Eulalie N. is a 70-year-old lady and a widow. She wants this loan to bolster her business fattening pigs and selling beverages. Her goal is to increase her revenues and to have financial autonomy in her work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising pigs and selling drinks and for small-scale commerce

loans.name: Veronica Zefanias

texts.pt:
Verônica Zefanias M. nasceu no distrito da Manhica (a 72 km a norte da cidade de Maputo) tem 44 anos de idade, mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 são maiores de idade e encontram se a estudarem nas escolas da cidade de Maputo.
Verônica estudou ate 5 classe tendo parado por insuficiência financeiras por parte dos seus pais.

Teve sua infância no distrito da Manhica na companhia dos seus progenitores e quando tinha cerca de 20 anos transferiu se com seu marido para cidade de Maputo, após o casamento.

Conseguiram comprar um terreno e construíram uma casa de material convencional onde vivem juntamente com os filhos e mais dois netos sob sua responsabilidade.
Tem um negocio de venda de refrigerantes, bebidas, recargas para celulares e outros produtos alimentícios a mais de 8 anos de experiência. Aprendeu fazendo e com ajuda do seu marido. Vende mais recargas para celulares e consegue um rendimento diário no valor de 1.500,00MT e poupa cerca de 7.000,00MT mensalmente.

Já teve empréstimos com outras instituições e quando ouviu falar das condições oferecidas pela Hluvuku-Adsema, através das amigas, pagou a divida que tinha e correu para solicitar este primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de diversos refrigerantes e recargas para celulares.

Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para poder aceder a novos empréstimos e cumprir o sonho de melhorar o seu negocio aumentando o volume do mesmo.
texts.en:
Veronica Zefanias M. was born in the district of Manhica (72km north of Maputo), she is 44 years old and is the mother of 4 children, 3 of them are adults and are studying at Maputo's schools. Veronica studied until the 5th grade having to stop because her parents lacked the financial resources to keep her in school. She grew up in Manhica and when she was 20, she moved with her husband to the city of Maputo, after their marriage. They were able to buy land and built a house with regular materials where they live with their children and two grand children who are their responsibility. Their business is to sell snacks, drinks, re-chargeable cards for cell phones and other groceries for the last 8 years. She learned the business with her husband's help. She sells more cell phone cards and obtains a daily income of 1.500,00MT and saves close to 7.000,00MT monthly. Veronica already had credit with other institutions and when she heard about the conditions offered by Hluvuku-Adsema, from some friends, she paid out the balance and run to request her first loan for 20.000,00MT to buy diverse snacks and cards for cell phones. She expects to pay without any problem and be able to get new loans and fulfill her dream to improve her business, by increasing its size.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy snacks and cards for cell phones

loans.name: Atalia Elisa

texts.pt:
Atalia Elisa M. nasceu na cidade Maputo tem 35 anos de idade e é mãe de 5 filhos todos são estudantes, um dos quais tem dezoito anos de idade. Estudou ate 5 classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras.

Atalia vive com o seu marido na casa própria e sem ninguém mais sob sua responsabilidade. Teve toda sua infância na cidade na companhia dos seus pais e aos 16 anos de idade juntou se com o seu marido, com qual vive ate hoje.
Tem 6 anos de experiência no negocio de venda de bebidas e refrigerantes sem empregado e trabalha quase a tempo inteiro.

Vende mais cervejas de marca 2m que compra a 22,00MT cada caixa e vende a 300,00MT e consegue um rendimento semanal de 3.500,00MT e ate poupa 4.000,00MT pro mês.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e logo que ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema, através das amigas, aproximou e solicitou este seu primeiro credito no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra do stock para satisfazer a demanda de produtos no seu estabelecimento convencional.

Espera pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para realizar o sonho de expandir o negocio e ampliar as instalações.
texts.en:
Atalia Elisa M. was born in Maputo, she is 35 years old and has 5 children, they are all studying, two of them are 18 years old. Atalia studied until the 5th grade but had to stop because of lack of financial resources. Atalia lives with her husband at their own house and they have no more responsibilities. She lived all her life in the city with her parents and when she was 16 she joined her husband and lives with him ever since. She has 6 years of experience in the business, selling drinks and snacks without any employees and works almost full time. Her best product is beer 2m that she buys at 22,00MT per box and sell at 300,00MT and gets an income of 3.500,00MT a week and saves up to 4.000,MT monthly. She never had credit with other institutions and after she heard about Hluvuku-Adsema from friends, she requested her first loan for 12.000,00MT to buy stock to satisfy the demand for products at her store. Atalia expects to pay the loan without any problem and be able to access other loans to fulfill her dream to expand her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy diverse products and snacks

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es:
María es Cuencana vive por la vía a  Misicata al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 59 años es viuda, tiene 4 hijos todos son mayores de edad con compromisos, vive en casa propia con toda su familia, trabaja más de 25 años en el mercado 12 de Abril, vende granos cocinados como fréjol, habas, choclo, mote, ensalada de verduras, lentejas, mellocos, arvejas, tostado, tiene buena clientela ya que el producto se presta para poder ganar amigas, cuenta que vende desde 25 centavos de dólar hasta galones que cuestan 5 a 10 dólares, trabaja en un horario de 7 de la mañana hasta las 2 a 3 de la tarde según como este la feria.
María cuenta que por las tardes deja cocinando el grano más duro como son los granos secos, y por la mañana se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para cocinar los que son los productos tiernos y verduras, María es acostumbrada a este ritmo de vida  dice que pude ser por el tiempo que ella trabaja, o también puede ser por la edad que ella tiene. Cuenta que este negocio le gusta mucho porque pasa más tiempo de su vida fuera de casa rodeada de sus amigas y como esta sola no tiene para que llegar a casa.
Solicitó este crédito para invertir en el negocio comprando granos, porque hoy es temporada de adquirir mas barato, es socia de la Fundación ESPOIR hace mucho tiempo, más o menos tiene unos 11 créditos anteriores, hoy solicitó 1100 dólares, espera algún día tener su propio capital para seguir trabajando. 
La meta que tiene María es poder tener un local más grande pero en el mismo sector, y tener su restaurante más presentable.
texts.en:
María is a native of Cuenca and lives along the road to Misicata, which is to the south of the city of Cuenca. She is 59 years old, widowed, and has 4 adult children who have their own responsibilities. She lives in her own home with her entire family. For 25 years, she has worked in the “12 de Abril” Market selling cooked items such as kidney beans, lima beans, corn, mote (corn stew), vegetable salad, lentils, mellocos (a local variety of potato), and roasted peas. She has a good customer base, and because of her products, she has been able to make new friends. Her food items sell for as little as $0.25 USD all the way up to $10 USD for 5 gallons. She works from 7am to 2-3pm, which are the same hours that the market is open.

In the evenings, María will simmer the harder grains, such as dried beans, and then will get up at 4am to cook the vegetables and other products that are tender. She said that she is used to this routine because she has been working this way for so long, or it could be that she doesn’t know how to work any differently at her age. She enjoys her work because she is always surrounded by her friends and doesn’t mind spending so much time away from home.

María is requesting a loan to buy grain, since prices are lower at the moment. She has been a member of Fundación Espoir for many years and has taken around 11 previous loans. At the moment, she is requesting $1100 USD and hopes that someday she will be able to use her own capital to keep her business going. Her goal is to have a larger vending location in the same line of business and also open a respectable restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène D. est âgée de 43ans, mère de 2 enfants avec 1 autre dont elle a la charge. Elle s’active dans l’aviculture et aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux améliorer les conditions de la famille.
texts.en:
Hélène D., age 43 is a mother of two children plus one other she supports. She is active in poultry farming and would like to bolster her business to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising poultry

loans.name: Marta Maria

texts.pt:
Marta Maria T. nasceu na cidade de maputo tem 40 anos de idade e é mãe de 3 filhos maiores de 18 anos, todos a estudarem excepto a mais velha que também já tem uma filha. Estudou ate 6 classe tendo parado por insuficiência financeira por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com os filhos, seu marido e mais um neto que esta sob sua responsabilidade.
Marta cresceu na cidade de Maputo e aos 19 anos conheceu o seu marido, com qual veio a juntar se, e nunca saiu da cidade.

Tem 5 anos de experiência no negocio de  criação de frangos de corte e sempre conta com ajuda dos seus filhos. Adquire os pintos na mesma cidade (maputo) a 16,00MT cada pinto e faz crescer para vender a 95,00MT cada frango e o custo de ração varia entre 650,00MT a 800,00MT por saco de 50 kg.

Rende 7.000,00MT em cada lote de 100 frangos e poupa 3.000,00MT no final de cada mês. Aprendeu a fazer esta actividade juntamente com os filhos pesquisando aos vizinhos, também criadores já com bastante experiência.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições e quando ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema, através de amigos, aproximou e solicitou este primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT que pretende comprar pintos e ração para produção de frangos de corte.

Com o credito espera ver o negocio a crescer e logo que concluir com o pagamento do presente credito vai solicitar outros empréstimos para aumentar o volume do seu negocio. Sonha ter construir, com os próximos empréstimos, também, uma capoeira fora da sua área residencial.
texts.en:
Marta maria T. was born in Maputo, she is 40 years old and has 3 children all over 18 years old, they all study except for the oldest who has a daughter too. Marta studied until the 6th grade, stopped because of the lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her children, her husband and one grandchildren who are their responsibility. Marta grew in Maputo, when she was 19 she met her husband, she married and never left the city. She has 5 years of experience in the business raising chickens with the help of her children. She gets the chicken in Maputo for 16,00MT each and she raise them to sell them for 95,00MT each, the cost of food for the chicken varies between 650,00MT to 800,00MT per sack of 50kg. She obtains 7.000,MT on each lot of chicken and saves 3.000,00MT each month. She learned to work on this activity with her children watching her neighbors, who are also raising chicken and have years of experience. She never had any credits with other institutions and when he heard about Hluvuku-Adsema from friends, she requested her first loan for 15.000,MT to buy chicken to raise them. With the loan she expects to see her business grow and after paying off the current loan she will request others to increase the volume of her business. She dreams on building with the new loans a place outside the residential area of her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken to raise and sell them

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 29 years old, married and a very hard-working young woman. Her commitment to service and friendliness attract lots of customers to her business center, a small printing shop where she does typesetting, photocopying, printing, and the preparation of cards and fliers. She runs the business with help from her husband. Anna says that the business is profitable because there are few shops in her community which perform similar services. She wants to take advantage of the loan to increase her profits. She will do this by buying a printer, a photocopier and other equipment needed for her center to operate efficiently.

loans.use: To buy a printer, photocopier and other equipment.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène N. est une veuve de 59 ans, avec 10 enfants en charge. Elle fait de l’élevage porcin et du petit commerce. Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène N. is a 59-year-old widow with ten children to look after. She raises pigs and works in small-scale commerce. Her goal is to support her family.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising pigs and small-scale commerce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a second store

loans.name: Sompa Group

texts.en:
Kwabena is 34 years old, married and the father of five children, all of whom are in school. He makes a living repairing refrigerators, and is very committed to work hard so that he can support his children’s education. He went into this line of work 11 years ago, and has built a shop in his town's community market. He allows many of his customers to pay him back for his repairs over a period of time, which means that he sometimes runs short of funds. To keep his business growing, he has applied for a loan to buy additional parts so that he can perform his work on time. This will allow him to earn enough money to provide all of his children with a good education. 

Kwabena leads a lending group called ‘Sompa’. In this photograph he is sitting at the center of the first row. Most of the other members of the group are retailers, food vendors and/or farmers. They guarantee each other's payments so that everyone has access to the loan and can pay the lender back on time.

loans.use: To buy parts to repair refrigerators

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new products for resale

loans.name: Rosa Fernando

texts.pt:
Rosa Fernando M. nasceu na cidade de maputo, tem 44 anos de idade e mãe de 4 filhos todos a estudar excepto o mais novo que tem 2 anos. Estudou apenas ate 2 classe tendo parado por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Cresceu na companhia da sua mãe porque o pai abandonara há bastante tempo tendo deixado a família num mar de dificuldades.

Vive na casa própria e não tem parentes sob sua responsabilidade.
Iniciou a actividade de venda de diversos produtos para sobrevivência da família e o negocio foi crescendo ate que há mais de dez anos começou a vender cadeiras plásticas no seu quintal e mais tarde conseguiu um espaço num local estratégico para o negocio (na terminal dos transportes inter provinciais na cidade).

Adquire o produto na África do sul a 168,00MT cada cadeira e vende a 230,00MT onde consegue um rendimento diário no valor de 1.000,00MT e não poupa.
Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e este é o seu primeiro com Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra e venda de cadeiras.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para no futuro construir uma casa de material convencional.
texts.en:
Rosa Fernando M. was born in Maputo, she is 44 years old and has 4 children who are all studying, the youngest one is 2 years old. She studied until the 2nd grade and had to stop because of lack of financial resources. She grew with her mother because her father left them leaving the family in a sea of difficulties. She lives in her own house and has no relatives under her responsibility. She started selling diverse products in order to support her family and the business started growing and after 10 years she started selling plastic chairs at her place and then she got a store in an strategic place for business (at the inter provincial transportation terminal in the city). Rosa gets her products in South Africa at 168,00MT each and sells them at 230,00MT she obtains a daily profit of 1.000,00MT and doesn't save. She never had credit with other institutions and this is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema for 12.000,00MT to buy chairs. She expects to pay the credit without any problems to get new ones in the future to build a house with regular materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs

loans.name: Ines' Group

texts.en:
Ines C. is preparing to receive her seventh loan with Esperanza. She has been working for several years with her niece, operating a beauty parlor. Her niece primarily cuts and colors hair, while Ines’ main job is providing hair products such as shampoos, conditioners, gels, etc. The business has been successful for the two, as Ines has returned to Esperanza several times, and each time she has requested a larger loan.

Through the fist six loans, Ines has been with Esperanza for almost four years, and during those four years she has maD. significant changes in her life. She recently bought a freezer with her savings, and has maD. other improvements to her home. She currently lives alone, and when I asked her if she wanted to make any other improvements in the future, she told me she wanted to find a husband and then asked me to join her. This led to abrupt laughter from the entire group. She was only kidding, and she reiterated her desire to improve her home and her business. Her next step is to buy cinder blocks to surround her house, because they proviD. better support in the event of a strong storm.

As each day passes, Ines and her niece are expanding their customer base. Ines explained to me that women in the Dominican Republic spend a lot on their appearance, so she believes there is no reason for her business to suffer. She sees an increasing demand for her products and plans on providing the needed supply.

loans.use: The purchase of shampoos, conditioners, gels, and other beauty products

loans.name: Okyeso Nyame Group

texts.en:
Mercy is 38 years old. She is a married woman with three boys. All her children are in school. She is a baker who has used flour for her production for eight years now. She bakes bread and retails it to her customers. She supplies them by herself in the market center, and people also take bulk delivery bread from her. Her only problem now has to do with inadequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and, most especially, for her children's education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Okyeso Nyame," which means "God of Abundance." She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Margarida da Conceição D. nasceu na cidade de maputo, tem 28 anos de idade e é mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade escolar. Estudou ate 6 classe tendo interrompido por falta de condições financeiras ( dinheiro para transporte ).
Vive em casa dos sogros com seu esposo e os filhos e sem ninguém mais sob sua responsabilidade.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e irmãos e aos 16 anos juntou se com o seu marido e tem saído sempre para o norte do pais para comprar produtos (Amendoim, Milho e Feijão manteiga). O seu negocio é de venda de cereais e roupa a mais de 2 anos de experiência. Aprendeu fazendo com a sua sogra. Vende mais feijão manteiga (produtos mais preferido) que compra o saco a 230,00MT e vende a 450,00MT e o seu rendimento mensal é de 9.000,00MT e consegue poupar 4.000,00MT por mês. Entrega os cereais aos clientes logo que chega de norte dos pais.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e aproximou a Hluvuku-Adsema, graças às informações obtidas através das amigas, e solicitou este seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de produtos diversos.
Propõe se apagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a outros créditos para ajudar o seu marido a concluir a loja e casa.
texts.en:
Margarida da Conceicao D. was born in Maputo, she is 28 years old and has 2 children who are in school. She studied until the 6th grade and had to stop because of lack of financial resources (money for transportation). She lives in the house of her parents in law with her husband and children and no one else under her responsibility. She grew with her parents and siblings and when she was 16 years old she married her husband and always went out to the north of the country to buy products (peanut, corn, beans, butter). At her business she sells cereal and clothing and has more than 2 years of experience. She learned it from her mother in law. She sells more beans and butter that buy at 230,00MT and sells at 450,00MT and her monthly income is 9.000,00MT and is able to save 4.000,00MT a month. She delivers the cereal to to her clients when she arrives from the north of the country. Never had credit with other institutions and came to Hluvuku-Adsema thanks to the information given by friends, and requested her first loan for 10.000,00MT to buy diverse products. She expects to pay the loan without any trouble to request other loans to help her husband to finish the ground floor of a house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and food to sell

loans.name: Unique Group

texts.en:
C. is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has six children who are in school. C. is very dedicated to her family and business. She is a food vendor and sells rice with gravy stew at the local community school. She started this work about four years ago to provide for her family. C. sells in the market during their market days. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to develop her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income and support the education of her children.

C. is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Unique’. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana  es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís 
Ana es casada tiene 32 años, tiene  un hijo D. 6 años que esta en la escuela estatal.
Ana estudio contabilidad en un instituto  pero no término, por que se le presento la oportunidad D. trabajar en ventas donD. aprendió D. ventas  se independizo por que tenía que cuidar a su hija. Ella actualmente se dedica alas ventas D. ropa y D. loceria.
DesD. que Ana esta en Finca, los prestamos  han sido D. ayuda para su desarrollo personal, ahora es independiente económicamente 
Ana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. mercadería y  loceria.
El sueño D. Ana es tener negocio propio, le gustaría poner un bazar.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the San Luís Community Bank. Ana is 32, married, and she has a six year old child who attends the state school. Ana studied accounting in school, but she did not finish. Instead, she had the opportunity to work in sales. She learned about sales, and she started on her own because she had to take care of her daughter. She currently sells clothing and pottery. Since Ana has been with Finca, the loans have helped her personal development. She is now economically independent. Ana needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy merchandise and pottery. Ana’s dream is to have her own business. She would like to set up a variety store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and pottery

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 33 years old. He is married, and the father of two children. Currently, the kids are in school. His family is doing very well, and he is so happy for that. He works in the service industry, sewing dresses and other clothing. He has been sewing for eight years now. He is a specialist in both men's and women's wear. His skills and designs are of a special class. He sews various kinds of styles that give his customers new looks, including kids' school uniforms, trousers, shirts, church attire, kaba and slit dresses, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. He wants to use the loan to buy more sewing supplies, like linen, thread, thimbles, etc., to increase his output and efficiency. Due to his dedication and hard work, he has one apprentice whom he is training for the future. He hopes to increase his savings to provide his children with a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more sewing supplies, like linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela  es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís 
Mariela  es conviviente tiene 47 años, tiene tres hijos de 25, 20 y 15 años, este ultimo esta en la escuela estatal. 
Mariela ella es ama de casa, pero por necesidad tuvo que trabajar empezó a tejer y hacer bordados en cojines, les da a una amiga  que tiene su tienda en Villa el Salvador.
Desde que Mariela esta en Finca aprendió a ser  mas responsable en los pagos que se le da.
Mariela necesita un préstamo de  800 soles, para la compra telas e hijos al por mayor en gamarra.
Mariela tiene un sueño de tener su propia tienda de bazar.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the San Luis Village Bank. Mariela is 47 years old, married and has three children of ages 25, 20 and 15 years old. The last child is in public school. Mariela is a house wife, but because of necessity has also worked sewing and making borders for cushions, which she then gives to a friend who has a store in Villa el Salvador. Since Mariela started working with Finca, she has learned to be more responsible with her payments and invoices. Mariela needs a loan of 800 soles for the purchase of fabric and other supplies at wholesale prices in Gamarra. Mariela's dream is to someday have her own market business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale fabrics

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís.
Cecilia es conviviente  tiene 39 años, cuatro hijos de 22, 20, 16 y 5 años, los dos últimos están estudiando en la escuela estatal.   
Cecilia estudio  industria alimenticia en la universidad  San Marcos por seis meses y en un centro de educación  ocupacional  estudio repostería, con lo que le enseñaron se puso a trabajar  haciendo dulces y los vende en el mercado y ha dejar a puestos, también  hace por pedidos. 
Desde que Cecilia esta en Finca  aprendió a ser solidaria con su compañeras y aprendió a compartir.
Cecilia necesita un préstamo de  1200 soles, para la compra de materiales  de repostería, una balanza para comida, harina leche, huevos.  
Cecilia tiene un sueño que es tener una dulcería.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of Bancomunal San Luis. She is 39 years old and has a common law marriage. Cecilia has four children, ages 22, 20, 16 and 5. The 16 and 5 year olds go to public school. Cecilia attended San Marcos University for six months where she studied Food Science. She studied pastry making at a vocational institute and was able to put her learning to use by baking pastries to sell in the market. She also distributes them to other vendor’s to sell at their stalls. Cecilia makes pastries by special order as well. Through her participation in Finca Perú, Cecilia has learned to collaborate and share with her colleagues. She has asked for a loan of 1,200 soles (US$425) to buy pastry making supplies, a food scale, flour, milk and eggs. Cecilia’s goal is to someday own a pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pastry making supplies

loans.name: Liberian United For Progress Group

texts.en: Samuel is single and currently at the university. He has been selling charcoal, bought wholesale, at retail prices for the past five years. He’s challenged by too many people's involvement in the sale of the business. His dream is to grow to the level of sustainability to enable him to sustain his business.

loans.use: additional bags of charcoal bought wholesale for resale retail

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís 
Matilde es casada tiene 57 años, tiene ocho  hijos los dos últimos de 17 y 9 años  que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Matilde trabajaba confeccionando ropa al por mayor en Gamarra, pero tuvo que dejarlo cuando salio embarazada, y se  matriculo en una  academia para aprender a tejer carteras de hilos y chompas, ahora las vende en los mercados las carteras y las chompas y hace pedidos.  
Desde que Matilde esta en Finca aprendió a ser responsable con los préstamo que recibe, son para el negocio.
Matilde  necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de lanas, hilos y accesorios para hacer carteras.
El sueño de Matilde es tener  un bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
Matilde is a member of Bancomunal San Luis. She is 57, married, and has eight children. Her youngest are 17 and 9 and both go to public school.

Matilde used to sew clothes wholesale in Gamarra, but she had to quit that job when she got pregnant. She then enrolled at an Academy where she learned to knit cotton purses and sweaters. She currently sells the purses and sweaters she makes in the market. She also makes them by special order.

Since joining Finca Perú, Matilde has learned to invest the loans responsibly in her business. She has asked for a loan of 1,200 soles (US$425) to buy yarn, as well as cotton and the accessories she needs for the purses. Matilde’s goal is to someday run a small store out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yarn, cotton and accessories to make purses

loans.name: Julia Herminia

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís. 
Julia es casada tiene 7 hijos el ultimo tiene 12 años que esta estudiando en al escuela estatal.
Julia trabaja desde los  16 años, donde trabajaba  la señora  se dedicaba hacer pasteles y ella aprendió,  la señora se murió, Julia se quedo  sin trabajo, y se puso en su casa hacer pasteles ella los vende en los colegios, hospitales, los sábados y domingos limpia casas. 
Desde que Julia esta en Finca  su  capital ha crecido.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  la compra de harina, mantequilla, huevos. 
El sueño de Julia es trabajar  para comprase un carro para a ser movilidad escolar.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of Bancomunal San Luis. She is married and has seven children. Her youngest is 12 and goes to public school. Julia has been working since she was 16 years old. She learned to bake with the woman she used to work for, who baked cakes for a living. When the lady died Julia lost her job, so she started to bake cakes at home. She now sells them to schools and hospitals. She cleans houses on Saturday and Sunday. Julia’s financial resources have increased since she joined Finca. Julia has asked for a loan of 1,200 soles ($425). She will use the money to buy flour, butter and eggs. Her goal is to eventually buy a car to provide school transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and eggs

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène S. est une mariée, mère de 6 enfants. Elle tient un poulailler et fait aussi du commerce de produits de teinture. Elle aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Hélène S. is married and the mother of 6 children. She has a henhouse and also sells dye products. She would like to improve her business in order to better provide for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For bird farming and selling dye products

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Amada  es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís 
Amada es madre soltera, tiene 56 años, dos hijos de 38 y 16 años el ultimo esta estudiando en al escuela estatal.
 Amada  desde muy joven se dedico a trabajar en las ventas, empezó vendiendo libros y revistas le iba muy bien de repente las ventas empezaron a bajar, y ya no le resultaba,  tuvo que buscar otra cosa que vender,  se puso a vender desayunos en la  calle en una carreta  con los años a logrado tener un puesto reconocido por la municipalidad donde da desayunos todos los días de lunes a sábado, todas las mañanas.    
Desde que Amada esta en Finca cuenta con más capital para invertir, su economía ha mejorado.
Amada necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de café, leche, pollo, embutidos, para dar desayunos.
El sueño de Amada es tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Amada is a member of the Bancocomunal San Luis. She is a 56 year old single mother with two children, ages 38 and 16. The youngest is studying in a state school.

From a very young age, Amada has been involved in working in sales. She began selling books and magazines, which went very well for her until suddenly sales began to go down and no longer succeeded for her. She had to look for something else to sell and began selling breakfast in the street from a cart. With the years she succeeded in having a recognized spot by the city hall where she makes breakfasts every morning from Monday to Saturday.

Since Amada is in Finca calling upon on more capital for investing, her economic situation has improved. Amada needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of coffee, milk, chicken and sausages in order to make breakfasts. Amada's dream is to have a clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of coffee, milk, chicken and sausages

loans.name: Successful Women Group

texts.en: Sarah is a 54-year-old Liberian, married with 5 children (ages 12, 15, 18, 27, and 29). She has been engaged in the sale of dry goods (pepper, salt, Maggi cubes, rice, tomatoes, etc.) for the past 10 years. Her 10-year business was begun with L$500 (Liberian dollars) and faces the challenge of fund shortage. She is successful when there is clear environment, good business, and a friendly approach to customers

loans.use: additional dry goods for table-top selling

loans.name: Persa Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Ysabel es  viuda, tiene 55 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos de 29,27, 25, y 18 años, ellos trabajan y estudian educación superior.
Ysabel ha incursionado en otros negocio, ha puesto en su casa un bazar, también se ha puesto a coser forros para muebles. 
Desde que Ysabel está en Finca, su visión de negocio ha crecido, gracias a las charlas que recibe de cómo mejorar su empresa.
Ysabel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  para invertirlos en cosas de bazar, adornos, regalos.
El sueño de Ysabel  es tener una librería imprenta.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of Bancocomunal Siempre Juntas. She is a 56 year old widow with four children, ages 29, 27, 25, and 18. They work and are studying in higher education. After venturing into other businesses, Ysabel has put a shop in her house and has also begun to sew covers for furniture.

Since Ysabel is in Finca, her vision of her business has grown thanks to the talks she receives on how to improve her business. Ysabel needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to invest in things for the shop, decorations and gifts. Ysabel’s dream is to have a bookshop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investing in things for her shop, decorations, gifts

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Haydee es  casada tiene 42 años, cinco hijos de 26, 25, 22,19 y 16 años, este último está en la escuela estatal.  
Haydee  se dedicaba a su casa hasta  que le propusieron trabajaba bordando par una empresa de exportación, en su casa por seis años bordando, decidió abrir una bodega no le fue bien tuvo que cerrarla, con sus ahorros compro un carro para hacer servicio de taxi,  y se dedico a vender menú en su casa, con las ganancias ha comprado otros dos carros, los cuales los da para hacer servicio de taxi.
