Desde que Haydee esta en Finca  aprendió a invertir en el negocio y le está yéndole  bien. 
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de llantas y baterías para sus carros.
El sueño de Haydee es poner un salón de belleza porque ella estudio cosmetología.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of Bancomunal Siempre Juntas. She is 42 and married. Haydee has five children, ages 26, 25, 22, 19 and 16. Her youngest child goes to public school.

Haydee was a housewife until she was approached to embroider for an exporting company, which she did at home for 6 years. She opened a small food store, but it didn’t work out and she closed it. With her savings she bought a car and started a taxi business. She also started to serve meals at home. She has bought two additional cars with her earnings, which other people drive for the taxi service.

Through Finca Perú, Haydee has learned to invest in her business and it is going well. She has asked for a loan of 2,000 soles (US $675) to buy tires and batteries for her cars.

Haydee studied Cosmetology and her goal is to someday start a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and batteries for her taxis

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène T. est une mariée, mère  de 3 enfants avec 2 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle fait de l’embauche porcine et de la volaille. Elle prépare et vend en même temps de la crème glace, activité très rentable en cette période de forte canicule. Elle aimerait renforcer son capital et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène is married, and the mother of three children, with two more under her care. She has a pork and chicken business, and prepares and sells ice cream at the same time. This activity is very profitable, especially in this time of extreme heat. She would like to increase her working capital and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling pigs, chickens, and ice cream

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Esther  es madre soltera tiene 51 años, una hija de 29 años que trabaja. 
Esther  es de Huancayo es profesora, pero cuando llego a Lima dejo de trabajar por que se caso y se dedico a cuidar a su hija, pero se separa de su esposo y  se pone a trabajar en la venta de abarrotes y de plásticos tiene un puesto en  una feria desde hace 25 años. 
Desde que Esther esta en Finca  aprendió a trabajar y a ser responsable con el pago.
Esther necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para comprar abarrotes y platos, descartables, bolsas. 
El sueño de Esther es tener otro puesto de trabajo.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Always Together (Siempre Juntas) Community Bank. She is 51 years old and is a single mother of a 29-year-old daughter, who is working. Esther is from Huancayo and was a teacher, but when she came to Lima, she stopped working because she got married and was taking care of her daughter. When she and her husband separated, however, she started selling groceries and plastic products. She has had a stand in a fair for 25 years. Since she has been with Finca, Esther has learned to work and to be responsible with repayments. Esther needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy groceries, plates, disposable products, and bags. Her dream is to have another stand for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries, plates, disposable products, and bags

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Ninolaza es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Nicolaza es  casada tiene 55 años, tiene tres hijos que son mayores y trabajan. 
Nicolaza es de puno en su tierra se dedicaba a cuidar ganado, cuando llego a Lima a los 30 años se caso desde entonces se puso a vender tubérculos y verduras  en un puesto que alquilo el mercado de Pamplona Baja, con la ayuda de su hija., 
Desde que Nicolaza está en Finca su capital ha crecido y tiene muchas ideas de negocio..
Incolaza necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para comprar diferentes variedades de papa por saco, limos por saco, cajones de tomate y paquetes de verduras.
El sueño de Nicolaza es poner otros puestos de verduras en otros mercados.
texts.en:
Nicolaza is a member of the Always Together (Siempre Juntas) Community Bank. She is 55 years old, is married, and has three children, who are adults and are working. Nicolaza is from Puno, where she raised livestock. She came to Lima when she was 30 years old, when she got married. Since then she has sold tubers and vegetables in a stand that she rents in the Pamplona Baja Market, with the help of her daughter. Since Nicolaza has been with Finca, her capital has grown and she has many ideas for her business. Nicolaza needs a loan for 3000 soles to buy different varieties of sacks of potatoes, sacks of limes, boxes of tomatoes and packets of vegetables. Nicolaza’s dream is to have other vegetable stands in other markets.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different varieties of potatoes

loans.name: Concerned Women Group

texts.en: Garmai is married with 7 children (aged 26, 23, 21, 19, 16, 14, and 10); their levels of education are college,11th, 8th, 7th, 4th, and 1st grade respectively. She’s currently engaged with the sale of fish (purchased wholesale and sold retail) with 18 years of experience in the business. Garmai dreams of her business moving forward as she’s desirous of seeing her family becoming successful as well.

loans.use: additional cartons of fish for sale retail

loans.name: Yethy

texts.es:
Yethy es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Yethy es conviviente tiene 42 años, tiene 3 hijos, los dos últimos  de 11 y 6 años están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Yethy trabajaba en una tienda vendiendo juguetes, por años junto su  dinero, alquilo una tienda y se puso a vender relojes y también vende oro y plata, en el distrito de  San Juan.
Desde que Yethy está en Finca aprendió por las charlas que dan, a como separar el capital de las ganancias, a llevar su libro caja  a manejar mejor su negocio.  
Yethy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para comprar repuestos de  relojes, correas, lunas.  
El sueño de Yethy es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Yethy is a member of the Always Together (Siempre Juntas) Community Bank. She is 42 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. The two youngest are 11 and 6 years old, and they are studying in a government school. Yethy worked in a store selling toys. After some time, she rented a store and was able to sell watches. She also sells gold and silver. Her business is located in the district of San Juan. Since Yethy has been with Finca, she has learned, through the talks that they have, how to separate capital from earnings and to take her savings book to manage her business better. Yehty needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy spare watches, belts, and mirrors. Yethy’s dream is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare watches, belts, and mirrors

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Ysabel es  conviviente, tiene 52 años, tres hijos mayores, que trabajan y son independientes.
Ysabel trabaja vendiendo de todo lo que sus clientes le piden, pero se presento la oportunidad de de trabajar  en  un centro de educación ocupacional, ella acepto aprendió  hacer panes, pasteles, y los vende 
Desde que Isabel esta en Finca, gracias a las charlas de negocio que recibe aprendió a administrar su economía y su negocio. 
Isabel necesita un préstamo de  800 soles,  para invertirlos en  ingredientes para hacer pasteles harina, azúcar 
El sueño de Isabel es  tener un negocio propio, una panadería.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of "Bancomunal Siempre Juntas." She is 52 years old. Ysabel lives with her partner and has 3 grown children that work and are independent. Ysabel works selling anything her clients order, but she was presented with the opportunity to work at a center for occupational education. She accepted and learned to make breads and cakes to sell. Thanks to the business education she has received since being at Finca, Isabel has learned to manage her finances and her business.

Isabel needs a loan of 800 soles to invest in ingredients to make cakes: wheat and sugar. Isabel's dream is to have her own business, a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in cake ingredients

loans.name: Vista Al Mar Grupo 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria H. is moving on to her second loan with Esperanza. She successfully completed her first loan by investing in her store, known as a colmado. Colmados are basically little grocery stores that dot the corners of most villages. Maria owns a little colmado, and with the loan she was able to grow her business with both improvements to the existing store and by selling a larger variety of products.

Prior to coming to Esperanza, Maria was raising four children aged 19, 15, 13, and 11 on a limited income from her small colmado. Maria came to Esperanza because she knew if she could get a loan to invest in her business she could significantly increase her income. This increase in income would allow her to make improvements in all aspects of her life, most importantly with her children.

Since her first loan, she has maD. minor improvements to her home and store. She bought a freezer for her store which allows her to sell more products. In her home, she now has running water and a door. These minor improvements have encouraged her to come back to Esperanza for another loan so she can replicate her success.

loans.use: Improvements and purchase of more products for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
La asociación "Sol Radiante" se reúne cada dos semanas en el centro focal German Buch, actualmente esta fomada por once miembros, los cuales trabajan hace mas de tres años junto a Pro Mujer. 
Diferentes son los negocios de este grupo, como ser; venta de fruta, elaboración y venta de comida, artesanía en tejidos, artículos de ferretería, y otros.
La asociación sol Radiante desea ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesita capital para comprar productos para sus negocios. (Variedad de frutas, arroz por quintal, lana y otros dependiendo el caso).
texts.en:
The Sol Radiente ("Radient Sun") Association meets every two weeks in the German Buch center. At present the group is formed of eleven members, who have worked together with Pro Mujer for more than three years.

The businesses of this group are varied: fruit sales, food preparation and sales, woven handicrafts, hardware materials, and others. The Sol Radiente Association wishes to expand their sales, for which they need capital to purchase products for their businesses (a variety of fruits, rice, wool and other things depending on the business).

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Evelyn Carolina

texts.es: Evelyn Carolina M. D. P. resiD. en la Capital del país San Salvador, es una mujer casada con 42 años D. edad ,vive en casa propia  con su familia integrada por su esposo don Gustavo y sus tres hijos todos menores D. edad, quienes actualmente se encuentran estudiando. Evelyn posee su negocio es una tienda  que se encuentra ubicada en su casa, ya con 10 Años D. experiencia y por la cual ella ahora solicita este crédito ya desea surtirla D. productos en granos básicos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes, D. esta manera Evelyn logrará aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Evelyn Carolina M. D. P. lives in San Salvador, the capital city of El Salvador. She is a married woman of 42 years and lives in her own house with her family maD. up of her husband Gustavo and their three children, who are all minors and currently studying. Evelyn has a store in her house, in which she has been busy for ten years. She applies now for a credit which she will use to stock up her store with staple grains which are in high demand, so that she can increase her sales and get more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains for her store

loans.name: Felipe Arturo

texts.es: Felipe Arturo M. B. reside en Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Felipe tiene  36 años de edad  vive con su familia en casa propia; Felipe posee un negocio donde se dedica de forma ambulante a comercializar verduras y huevos en diferentes colonias y pueblos de Sonsonate, Felipe maneja su desgastado carro cargado con todos sus productos donde muchos de sus clientes ya saben la hora y el día que llegara,  para esperarlo y abastecerse de la buena calidad que ofrece la mercadería de Felipe. El destino del crédito que solicita Felipe es para surtir de variedad de sus productos como frutas y mayor cantidad de huevos de gallina.
texts.en:
Felipe Arturo M. B. lives in Armenia in the department of Sonsonate. He is 36 years old and lives with his family in their own house. Felipe is a hawking merchant who sells vegetables and eggs in several residential neighborhoods and villages of Sonsonate. He loads all his products into his worn car and drives to his customers. Many of them know the day and time when he travels to their area and wait for him to come and supply them with his high quality products. Felipe applies for a loan to stock up his inventory, in particular by various fruits and a larger quantity of hen’s eggs.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Santiago Berdugo

texts.es: Santiago Berdugo R. de 44 años de edad reside en  Ciudad Arce departamento de La Libertad. Santiago vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija Iris de 15 años de edad. Santiago se dedica a la venta ambulante de varios productos como medicina popular que no requiere prescripción médica, ropa de cama y hamacas; para vender su mercadería Santiago viaja a varios departamentos del país sin importar la distancia a la que se encuentren ya que el propósito de Santiago es generar buenos ingresos para la educación superior de su hija; es por eso que el solicita un crédito ya que desea adquirir mayor cantidad de medicina que le ayude a aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Santiago, age 44, resides in Ciudad Acre in the department of La Libertad. Santiago lives in his own house with his wife and 15 year old daughter, Iris. Santiago is engaged in the itinerant sale of several products such as popular medicines that don’t require a prescription, clothing, bed linen, and hammocks.

Santiago travels to several departments of the country without regard to the distance he encounters since his purpose is to generate good income for the higher education of his daughter. He is applying for a loan because he wishes to acquire a greater quantity of medicine that will help him increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicines to stock his inventory

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Lilliam Carolina

texts.es: La señora Lilliam Carolina Arévalo M., ella tiene 39 años, es  madre soltera y posee 2 hijos menores de edad. La señora Lilliam M. tiene aproximadamente 7 años de dedicarse de dedicarse a la venta de ropa variada, la cual vende de forma ambulante. Ella empezó con una pequeña cantidad de ropa, con capital propio. Todos los fines de semana visita a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares para ofrecer sus productos, a pesar de que toda la semana pasaba en su trabajo, guardaba energías para  los fines de semana. Después poco a poco fue introduciéndose al negocio de la venta de cosméticos y adornos. Además Lilliam labora en una casa comercial pues el sueldo que gana no es lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos y su familia. Su sueño es tener una tienda, dejar de trabajar y dedicarse específicamente a la administración de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Lilliam Carolina Arévalo M. is 39 years old, and is the single mother of two children under 18. Ms. Lilliam M. has been working in clothing sales for approximately 7 years, selling as an ambulatory vendor.

She began with a small quantity of clothing using her own capital. Every weekend she visits her friends, neighbors and family members to offer her products, even though she used to work all week, she would save some energy for the weekend. After that, little by little she began getting started selling cosmetics and accessories.

In addition, Lillim used to work in a store but the salary she earned was not enough to cover the expenses of her children and family. Her dream is have a store, stop working, and dedicate herself entirely to administrating her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Esteher

texts.es: Esteher S. de 48 años de edad reside en el municipio de San Martin ubicado en la capital del país. Esteher  tiene tres hijos quienes se encuentran ya casados y fuera de casa, es por eso que Esteher vive sola; ella posee su negocio en el cual vende variedad de productos de consumo, la tienda de Esteher tiene trece años de estar funcionando, ella posee una clientela muy estable ya que es una persona muy amable y feliz cuando sus clientes la buscan, también en la zona no hay competencia de otro negocio como el de Esteher; el crédito que solicita es para surtir su negocio  ya que desea comprar productos al por mayor lo que le ayudara a  obtener  un margen mayor de ganancia cuando ella lo venda al detalle en su tienda.
texts.en:
Esteher S. is 48. She lives in the San Martín municipality, which is located in the country’s capital. Esteher has three married children who do not live with her. Esteher lives alone. She sells a variety of consumer products. Esteher has had her store for 13 years. She has a stable customer base. She is a very kind person, and she is happy when her customers come to her. Also, there is no competition from another business like Esteher’s. The loan she is asking for is to stock her store. She wants to buy wholesale products that will help her get a greater margin of earnings when she sells for retail in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira Elizabeth S. de 37 años de edad reside en el municipio de Atiquizaya del departamento de Ahuachapán vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos Flankiln de 16 años, Mauricio de 2 años y el pequeño Marvin de 2 años de edad. Antonio esposo de Yanira se dedica a ser electricista, oficio que le ayuda a dar el aporte a su familia de US 150$ mensuales. Yanira posee una venta de lácteos y los findesemanas se dedica a la elaboración de comida para vender, el destino del crédito que solicita Yanira es para invertir en mercadería de los lácteos y comprar pollos y gallinas para los platillos de los findesemanas.
texts.en:
Yanira Elizabeth S. is 37 years old and lives in the municipality of Atiquizaya of the department of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband and three sons: 16-year old Flankiln and 2-year-olds Mauricio and Marvin. Antonio, Yanira's husband, is an electrician, which helps support the family with $150 per month. Yanira sells milk, and on the weekends she makes food to sell. The purpose of the loan that Yanira requests is an investment in the purchase of milk and chicken for the dishes she makes on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario del Carmen G. D. V. resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán , Rosario tiene 41 años D. edad, vive con sus  dos hijos Carlos D. 11 años y  Alberto D. 8 años, actualmente se encuentran estudiando. Rosario es una madre muy responsable y trabajadora con su familia siendo ella el único sustento para sus hijos , sale a trabajar día a día , en el mercado municipal D. Cuscatlán vendiendo productos D. belleza como cosméticos, gelatina para el cabello , esmaltes D. uñas, entre otros. Rosario tiene 15 años D. experiencia en su negocio; el crédito que solicita es para surtir su inventario, y así generar más ingresos a través D. sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosario del Carmen G. D. V. lives in the Cuscatlán department. Rosario is 41. She lives with her two sons; Carlos, 11, and Alberto, 8. They are currently in school. Rosario is a responsible and hard working mother. She is the only one who supports her children. She goes to work every day in the Cuscatlán municipal market. She sells beauty products like cosmetics, hair gel, nail polish, and other things. She has 15 years of experience in her business. The loan she is asking for is to stock her inventory and generate more income through her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Jane Jemaiyo

texts.en:
Jane K. is 37 years old and is married to a man named Philip.  They are blessed with three children.  Her business is located in the Iten suburb of Eldoret Town.

Jane has been in the clothing business for the past four years.  With this loan from KADET she intends to buy more clothing, a new sewing machine and other equipment for work.  Jane was introduced to KADET by a credit officer from the organization.

In future, Jane hopes to grow her business so that she and her husband will have enough income to be able to pay school fees for their children.  She also wants to be able to build a durable, permanent house for her family to live in.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more stock for a clothing shop and to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ninoska Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Ninoska Martínez tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos con edades de dos y nueve años. Ella se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de ropa usada, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante y también en su casa. Tiene 5 años de tener este negocio. La señora empezó este negocio con muy poca cantidad de ropa ya que en ese tiempo compraba muy poco, ahora ella compra por mayores cantidades, ya que vende mucho más que antes, y  posee mayor cantidad de compradores. También Ninoska labora medio tiempo como docente, para que sus hijos puedan tener la oportunidad de estudiar y para el sustento de su hogar. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de ropa, las cuales ya tiene los compradores, ya que ellos fueron los que le encargaron dicha ropa. Su meta siempre ha sido poder establecer su negocio, de tal manera que pueda vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ms. Ninoska M. is 30 years old, married, and has two children ages 2 and 9. She buys and sells used clothing as an ambulatory vendor and in her home. She has had this business for 5 years.

Ms. M. began this business with very little clothing because during that time she bought little clothing. Now she buys in bigger quantities because she sells much more than she did before and has a greater number of buyers. Also Ninoska works half-time as a teacher so that her children can have the chance to study and to support her household.

This loan will be used to purchase clothing for which she already has buyers because the customers were the ones who ordered this clothing. Her goal has always been to establish her business so that she can sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
K. Jane is the leader of Twezimbe group in Kigunga. She is 40 years old and a mother of 4 children (2 girls and 2 boys) and she cares for 2 dependants. Jane is a very hard working lady with a tailoring business that she has been running for 5 years. At the moment, she works from the main street outside another person’s shop plus working from her house.

She has a dream of one day owning her own business premises where she can even start a tailoring school mostly to admit young girls that would want to start something for the future. Jane needs a loan to be able to buy sewing and clothing materials for her customers’ orders and to display.

loans.use: To buy  more clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: María Delfina

texts.es: María Delfina A. D. S. resiD. en Ciudad Arce departamento La Libertad, 52 años D. edad, vive solamente con su  esposo, La Sra. María se dedica a la venta D. tortillas desD. su casa donD. tiene ya hace 7 años experiencia en dicha actividad, las tortillas D. María tiene una buena demanda ya que muchos D. sus clientes manifiestan que son las mejores del lugar por ser hechas con comal y no con cocina tradicional, el  crédito que solicita María es para compra D. maíz, lo que le permitirá aumentar su producción D. tortillas y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
María Delfina A. D. Saavedra lives in Arce city in the La Libertad department. She is 52, and she lives with her husband. María sells tortillas from her house. She has seven years of experience doing this. There is a good demand for Maria’s tortillas. Lots of her customers say that her tortillas are the best around because they are maD. with a “comal” (a clay or metal dish used for making tortillas) instead of the traditional way. The loan that María is asking for is to buy corn, which will allow her to increase her tortilla production and generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn to increase tortilla production

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia G. D. M. vive en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a su suegra y su dos hijos, ya que por la situación económica  el esposo se encuentra trabajando en Estados Unidos, Rosa  tiene una tienda en su casa desD. hace 6 años, la cual le permite generar ingresos para sus hijos , Rosa carece D. muchos productos como se pueD. ver en la fotografía en una tienda muy pequeña, pero Rosa quiere aprovechar estas vacaciones patronales ya que mucha gente viaja y transita por la calle donD. ella tiene ubicado su negocio es por eso que solicita este crédito para poder surtir su tienda y aprovechar sus ventas en el mes D. agosto.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia G. D. Mejia lives in the department of La Libertad together with her mother-in-law and her two children; because of the economic situation her husband is now working in the United States. Rosa has had a store in her house for 6 years, which helps her generate income for her children. Rosa lacks many products, as you can see in the photo of the small store, but Rosa wishes to take advantage of the holidays for the patron saints because many people travel and commute on the street where Rosa has her business. Rosa requests the loan in order to be able to stock her store and increase her sales in the month of August.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with goods

loans.name: William De Los Reyes

texts.es: El señor William Sánchez M. tiene  37 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene un hijo el cual es menor de edad.  Su esposa labora en una zona franca  por lo que ambos trabajan para mejorar la vida de sus hijos. El señor William M. posee un negocio de venta de productos veterinarios, los cuales vende en la zona norte del país. Don William Sánchez dio inicio a su negocio hace 4 años, porque tuvo la necesidad de sustentar a su familia. Cabe señalarse, que con los ingresos que le ha dejado su negocio ha logrado comprar una moto que le permita movilizarse con mayor facilidad. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías, ya que actualmente tiene varios pedidos. Su sueño con respecto al negocio es que este crezca y convertirse en un distribuidor mayoritario.
texts.en:
William Sánchez M. is 37 years old. He is married, and now has a young son. His wife works in a free trade zone. Both he and his wife work so that they can provide a better life for their children. Sr. M. owns a business selling veterinary products, which he sells in the northern part of the country. Don William Sánchez first began his business 4 years ago, because he needed to support his family. With the income earned from his business he has been able to buy himself a motorcycle, which allows him to travel with greater facility. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more goods for him to sell, since he presently has various orders from customers waiting to be filled. His dream with respect to his business is that it may grow and that he may become the major distributor of veterinary goods in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
N. Florence is the leader of Peace group in Mukono. She is a business-oriented lady with a strong drive to succeed. She has a business selling all kinds of beer, wine, spirits and sodas to her customers. She is grateful that, for the three years she has been in business, people are catching on thereby enabling her to make enough profits and savings for future developments.

She started getting loans 1 and a half years ago and she has been able to buy a plot of land that she is currently using for farming, but in future she will construct a family house. She needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more crates of beer, wine and spirits for sale. She hopes to one day have a large bar and be able to sell more drinks.

loans.use: Restocking her shop with more drinks.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 1 And 2 Group

texts.en:
Meet forty-six-year old Maritza Tamerez (third from the right). She lives in a rural barrio (community) called Palmaje that is about an hour outside the capital, Santo Domingo. Maritza plans to use her loan to improve the small food business that she runs out of her house. While she has always sold pica pollo (fried chicken) and arroz con habichuela (rice with beans), this loan will allow her to purchase more primary materials so she can better meet her demand. Furthermore, she plans to start vending ice cream in addition her normal meals. A side business of selling ice cream is actually quite innovative because the country is hot and it is inexpensive to buy and sell. Thus, the product sells rapidly. (Maritza referred to selling ice cream as fast money.) Furthermore, the small profit margins can help float and grow the primary business.

Maritza’s ultimate plan is to open a cafetería (café) in the main street of her town. Since she lives on the rural outskirts and currently sells from her house, this move will increase her demand and competitive edge.

Serving as a pastor and the mother of ten children (ages 8-25), Maritza’s main motivation for taking out a loan is so that she can better support her family and fellow church members. Maritza has taken on yet another leadership position as she serves as a group coordinator for the Bank of Hope Mujeres en Desarrollo (Women in Development).

On behalf of Maritza, Mujeres en Desarrollo, and the micro-finance institution Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities for those who need them most.

loans.use: materials for food preparation

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es: Carlos Mauricio R. reside en Cojutepeque del departamento de Cuscatlán, tiene  49 años de edad, vive con esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Carlos se dedica a su negocio una joyería y relojería la cual se encuentra ubicada en su casa donde lleva ya más de la mitad de su vida desempeñando dicho trabajo, son ya 35 años de experiencia que lo acompañan con los ha logrado  sacar adelante a toda su familia. Ahora Carlos solicita un crédito para surtir su inventario en joyería.
texts.en:
Carlos Mauricio R. live in Cojutepeque in the Cuscatlán department. He is 49, and he lives with his wife and four children. Carlos has a jewelry and watch business, which is located in his house. He has spent half of his life doing this work. He has 35 years of experience, which have helped him get his family ahead. Carlos now is asking for a loan to stock his jewelry inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jewelry stock

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
K. Rose is the leader of Hope group 1 in Kigombya. She is a hardworking, devoted and friendly lady with a business of selling new clothes of all kinds from a shop in Kigombya.

Rose has had the business for over three years and she is happy that, for the three cycles that she has been getting loans, her business is tremendously improving, her children are attending good schools, plus they are enjoying good food.

Rose needs a loan to be able to buy more new clothes that will bring in more profits.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more clothes

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio P. reside en Cojutepeque en el departamento de  Cuscatlán. Alexander tiene 31 años de edad,  vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos aun menores de edad. Alexander con cinco años de experiencia en su negocio se dedica a la elaboración de zapatos en variedad de diseños para niños y adultos, el deseo de Alexander y por lo cual solicita este crédito es porque quiere comprar materia prima por mayor ya que es la única manera con la cual obtendría una mejor ganancia y los mas importante siendo competitivo en el mercado, ya que los precios de Alexander van mas debajo de los otras zapaterías.
texts.en:
Alexander Antonio P. lives in Cojutepeque in the Cuscatlán department. Alexander is 32, and he lives with his wife and their four minor children. Alexander has five years of experience in his business of making shoes. He makes a variety of designs for children and adults. Alexander’s dream, the reason he is asking for this loan, is to buy wholesale raw materials. That is the only way he can get better earnings. The most important thing is to be competitive in the market. Alexander’s prices are below those of the other shoe makers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale raw materials

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: Grace S. is the leader of Hope Group 2 in Kigombya. She is a hard working lady with various businesses. As a poultry farmer, Grace raises both layers and broiler chickens for eggs and meat respectively, and is involved in the sale of poultry feed for other poultry farmers. She is also a farmer, and her chickens’ husks help to fertilize her plantations for high quality yields. Except for her farming enterprise, which she has had for a very long time, her businesses have only been in operation for 3 years. Since she has learned to manage her businesses, she does not regret not having had previous loans to increase her capital. Grace currently needs a loan to help buy more feed for her poultry farm, and for resale.

loans.use: Buying more feed for poultry, and for resale

loans.name: Santos Osmin

texts.es: Santos Osmin V. E. reside en el municipio Cojutepeque departamento de Cuscatlán. Santos es un hombre casado con 45 años de edad, vive con esposa y tres hijos mayores de edad, de los cuales dos trabajan y uno es estudiante universitario. Santos posee un negocio hace 2 años el cual consiste en la venta de granos básicos en la plaza de Cojutepeque, el deseo de Santos es tener mayor cantidad de sus productos para poderlos vender al por mayor lo que le permitiría generar un mayor ganancia, pero esto solo puede ser posible con su ayuda para financiar este crédito el cual el utilizara  Santos en la compra de mayor cantidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Santos Osmin V. E. lives in the Cojutepeque municipality in the Cuscatlán department. Santos is 45 and married. He lives with his wife and three grown children. Two of the children work and one is a university student. For two years Santos has been selling basic grains in the Cojutepeque plaza. Santos wishes to have a larger quantity of products to sell wholesale. This would allow him to have greater earnings. But, this is only possible with the help of a loan. Santos will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a larger quantity of basic grains

loans.name: Vilma Concepción

texts.es: Vilma Concepción C. reside en el municipio de Cojutepeque del  departamento de Cuscatlán. Vilma tiene 48 años de edad es  madre soltera , vive con sus tres hijos donde dos  de ellos son  mayores de edad  que se encuentran trabajando y su hijo más pequeño de 14 años de edad se encuentra estudiando, Esta madre ha luchado para sacar a sus hijos adelante;  hace unos años era empleada, pero ahora con ahorros y esfuerzo ha logrado colocar un negocio en su casa, es una librería surtida de variedad de productos en papelería hasta pequeños obsequios para regalar, pero ahora el deseo de Vilma y por el cual solicita este crédito es porque quiere comprar mercadería al por mayor, para logara obtener mayores ganancias de sus productos.
texts.en:
Vilma Concepción C. lives in the Cojutepeque municipality in the Cuscatlán department. Vilma is a 48 year old single mother. She lives with her three children. Two of the children are grown and work. Her youngest child is 14 and goes to school. This mother has fought to get her children ahead. For years she was an employee. Now, with savings and effort, she has been able to place a business in her house. It is a bookstore, which is stocked with a variety of products from stationery to small gifts. Vilma’s wish, the reason she is asking for this loan, is to buy wholesale merchandise. This way she can get greater earnings from her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: María de Jesús C. reside en Mejicanos en el  departamento de  San Salvador, La Sra. María tiene  55 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos nietos Mario de 20 años y Yessica de 12 años de edad. María  se dedica a la venta carne de tripa de vaca, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla, los  15 años de experiencia en su negocio le permite a María tener una clientela muy estable, ya que se caracteriza  por ser muy amable con sus clientes y vender  tripa de mejor calidad, el crédito que solicita María es para la compra de tripa de vaca ya que desea aumentar su inventario en dicha carne que es muy buscada por sus clientes.
texts.en:
María de Jesús C. lives in Mejicanos in the department of San Salvador. Mrs. María is 55 years old, and she lives with her husband and two grandchildren; Mario is 20 years old, and Yessica is 12 years old. María sells cow meat. Her business is located in the municipal market in Santa Tecla. She has 15 years of experience in her business, and this allows her to have a very stable clientele, since she is known to be very kind to her clients and because she sells high-quality meat. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cow meat, since she wants to increase her inventory because her clients demand her products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory of cow meat

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Arturo Gutiérrez García , tiene  41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor Gutiérrez García tiene la actividad económica de  un taller de reparación de bicicletas, en la que además vende los repuestos. Este está ubicado en el mercado. Don Carlos Gutiérrez dio inicio a su negocio hace  12 años con una pequeña cantidad de repuestos, influenciado en parte por sus familiares que se dedican a la venta de repuestos de bicicletas. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos de bicicletas, ya que su negocio está ubicado en una zona de fácil acceso que le permite realizar la venta de repuestos y además instalarlos al mismo tiempo, por lo que vende más. Su esposa trabaja como comerciante de ropa y artículos varios, por lo cual también aporta para el sustento del hogar. Su sueño siempre ha sido tener un taller grande el cual pueda abastecer a muchas personas y también brindar empleos.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Arturo Gutiérrez García is 41 years old, married, and has two young children. Mr. Gutiérrez García has a bicycle repair shop, where he also sells spare parts. Mr. Carlos Gutiérrez started his business twelve years ago with a small quantity of spare parts. He began repairing bicycles in part at the urging of his relatives.

He would use the loan to buy more spare parts for bicycles, because his business is located an easily accessible area which would permit the sale of more spare parts. Also because he can install these parts as well, he sells more.

His wife works dealing clothing and various other goods, which also contributes to their household income. His dream has always been to have a large store that could meet the demands of many people and also provide jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more bicycle parts

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: El señor Omar  C. C. tiene  31 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene un hijo de  8 años. El señor C. C. es dueño de un taxi, el ofrece el servicio de transporte. Don Omar C. comenzó su negocio de de transporte hace  5 años, por lo que anteriormente laboraba para plastinic, hubo un recorte de personal, y a él lo despidieron entonces, con su liquidación decidió comprar un vehículo para obtener ingresos para su familia porque como hombre responsable de su familia, tenía que encontrar un medio de vida. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos para el vehículo, además que quiere darle una retocada a la pintura y una enderezada al mismo vehículo. Su sueño es condicionar su unidad y con el tiempo adquirir otra para obtener más utilidad y ser un microempresario y por  y ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Omar C. C. is 31 years old, married, and has an 8 year old son. Sr. C. C. is the owner of a taxi, and he offers transportation services. Don Omar C. began his transportation business 5 years ago. He previously worked for Plastinic, which had a down-sizing and therefore they let him go. With his severance pay, he decided to buy a vehicle in order to earn income for his family. As he is the responsible man of his family, he had to find a way to earn a living.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for the vehicle, and furthermore, he wants to give it a touch up of paint and to repair the vehicle. His dream is to condition his unit, and with time to buy another to earn more profits, and to be a micro-businessman in order to help his family more.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael C. L. reside en  Santa Tecla departamento La Libertad. Rafael tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa Frida de 28 años y su hijo Javier de 5 años estudiante de kínder. El Sr. Rafael y su esposa se dedican a la elaboración y venta de licuados, también cocinan variedad de platillos de comida rápida para ser vendidos, tienen dos años de experiencia donde les ha ido muy bien ya que no cuentan con competencia en la zona, el crédito que solicita Rafael es para la compra de materia prima para aumentar su producción diaria, lo cual le ayudara a generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rafael C. L. lives in Santa Tecla, in the department of La Libertad. Rafael is 53 years old, and he lives with his wife Frida, who is 28 years old, and their son Javier, who is 5 years old and is in kindergarten. Mr. Rafael and his wife make and sell milk shakes. They also cook a variety of fast-food small plates to sell. They have two years of experience, and this business has been going well for them, since there isn’t a lot of competition in the area. Rafael is requesting this loan to buy the raw materials to increase his daily production, which will help him earn a larger income.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor Pedro José L. P. actualmente tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Tiene  52 años, El señor P. L. posee un taller de carpintería el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación. El realiza sus ventas principalmente por encargos. Don Pedro P. dio inicio a su negocio hace 30 años, el cual surgió como una necesidad para sustentar a su familia. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materias primas para su negocio, ya que actualmente posee una buena cantidad de pedidos. Su sueño siempre ha sido ampliar el negocio y comprar activos fijos en el futuro que le permitan desarrollar un trabajo de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro José L. P. has 3 older children, and is 52 years old. Sr. P. L. owns a carpentry workshop, which is located in his own home. He makes his sales primarily through jobs by request. Don Pedro P. initially began his business 30 years ago, which arose from the necessity to support his family.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials for his business, since he currently has a good amount of requests. His dream has always been to expand his business and buy fixed assets in the future to allow him to develop work of the highest quality.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Miledy Cruz V. is 50 years old and is the coordinator for 'Jesus nuestra Esperanza', a micro-finance loan group of Esperanza International. She lives with her husband, four sons, and two grandchildren in Las Avispas, an impoverished but beautiful village outside of Puerta Plata. There is not nearly enough space for her whole family in her tiny home, which only has two beds.

Miledy tells me that although she is grateful for what she has, her health, a loving family, and her faith, she wishes she could help to provide a better life for her children and grandchildren. She wants to send Rican and Ronnie, who are 27 and 17 respectively, to university. She wants to expand her house so that her children don’t have to argue over who gets to sleep in the beds.

With these dreams in mind, Miledy came to Esperanza to take a micro-loan and create her business. Actually, she has started two. During the day, she sells used clothes along her street and in her neighborhood. She buys these clothes from Santiago, which is about 2-3 hours away. At night, she runs a food stand from which she sells hot-dogs and sandwiches.

Miledy has taken four loans from Esperanza since starting her business. Her first loan was for 6,000 RDP. Now her business has expanded to the point where she needs a 10,000 RDP loan to buy enough inventory for resale.

Miledy has big dreams for her clothing business. Ultimately, she hopes to purchase clothes internationally, where she could find cheaper prices than in the Dominican Republic. She then hopes to sell them in areas that are busier than her own neighborhood. Miledy’s vision for a better life and a better business is coming true, but she needs access to micro-credit to make it happen. Thanks for taking the time to read her story and for considering her for a loan.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing and ingredients for food stand

loans.name: Adrian De Jesus

texts.es: Adrian Jesús M.  S. tiene 35 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Adrian es un hombre muy luchador que le gusta su trabajo, a pesar de que algunas veces es muy agotador. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a cuidar ganado. Pero con el dinero que lograba obtener compro una bicicleta, por lo que al principio fue un problema ya que no tenía la experiencia que necesitaba y que la obtuvo con el tiempo. El financiamiento que solicita es para brindarle  mejoras a su bicicleta y proporcionarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Su deseo es lograr que sus hijos sean unos profesionales ya que Adrian no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Adrian Jesús M. S. is 35 years old, is married, and is taking care of 2 children. He is a fighter and likes his work, even though, at times, it is very exhausting. He offers a tricitaxi (a bicycle-operated taxi) service. He has been pursuing this activity for more than 6 years. Before this, he raised livestock, but with the money from that, he succeeded in buying a bicycle. At first, he didn’t have the experience needed for this, but over time, he got it. This loan that he is requested will be used to make improvements to his bicycle and to provide a better service to his clients. His dream is to succeed and for his children become professionals, since Adrian didn’t have the opportunity to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Dialika

texts.fr: Dialika C. est jeune mariée de 28 ans, mère de 2 enfants. Elle achète du savon artisanal qu’elle revend en détail au marché hebdomadaire de Diaobé avec l’aide de son mari conducteur de camion. Elle aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux participer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Dialika C., age 28, is a young married mother of two children. She buys artisanal soap that she sells retail at the weekly market of Diaobé with the help of her husband, who is a truck driver. She would like to bolster her business in order to help further with covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying and reselling hand-made soap

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es: Jesús Antonio A. F. reside en ciudad Arce departamento San Salvador. Jesus tiene 56 años de edad  vive solamente con su esposa quien le ayuda en el negocio es una tienda con productos de consumo y  en su mayoría granos básicos, también tiene un molino  el cual tiene mucha demanda por ser único en la zona , el reconocimiento de los clientes a través de los 10 años de experiencia  en su negocio han hecho que  ahora sigan aumentando las ventas y demandan en granos básicos es por eso que solicitan este crédito para surtir su tienda en la compra de granos como maíz, frijol, arroz, azúcar , huevos, aceite.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonio A. F. lives in Arce city in the San Salvador department. Jesús is 56, and he lives with his wife. She helps him in his business, which is a store that sells food. He primarily sells basic grains. He also has a mill, which is in great demand because it is the only one in the area. His customers appreciate his ten years of experience in the business. That has increased his sales and the demand for basic grains. That is why he is asking for this loan to stock his store and buy products like corn, beans, sugar, eggs, and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his store

loans.name: Lady Dania

texts.es: Lady Dania S. O. tiene la edad de 28 años. Es una mujer casada y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ella misma atiende a sus clientes, y como ha logrado realizar muchos sacrificios a mantenido su record crediticio. Sin embargo a Lady se le presentaron algunos problemas de salud con su hijo, y tenía que cuidar a su hijo. Pero siguió luchando para seguir adelante con su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y vestidos por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes solicitan. Su mayor deseo es proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Lady Dania S. O. is 28 years old, married, and has one son. Her business is the sales of second-hand clothes. She has had this business serving her customers for more than 5 years. She has made many sacrifices to maintain her credit record. However, Lady´s son has experienced some health problems, and she had to take care of her son. But she continued fighting to move on with her business. The reason for the loan is for working capital for the purchase of shirts, pants, skirts, and dresses, which are the majority of her customers´ requests. Her biggest wish is to be able to provide her family bread every day.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne F.  est une femme mariée, mère de 4 enfants avec 4 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle tient une boutique où elle fait un commerce de divers produits alimentaires. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’assurer une scolarité à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Julienne F. is a married woman and the mother of four children, plus she has four others to support. She has a shop where she does commerce in various food items. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions and to ensure her children are educated.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For running a grocery store

loans.name: Laura Esperanza

texts.es: Laura Esperanza M. D. V. resiD. en Lourdes en el departamento D. La Libertad. Laura tiene  47 años D. edad, vive con su esposo Don José D. 55 años. Laura posee un negocio ubicado en su casa es una Panadería donD. elaboran variedad D. pan dulce y francés en el negocio le ayuda su esposo encargándose D. distribuirlo en las tiendas y vecinos D. la zona, tienen tres años D. experiencia en su negocio donD. mes a mes han ido mejorando sus ventas y al día D. ahora no logran cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes por la poca producción que elaboran es por eso que solicitan este crédito ya que desean aumentar su producción en pan lo que también les ayuda a tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Laura Esperanza M. D. V. lives in Lourdes in the department of La Libertad. Laura is 47 years old and lives with her husband Don José, who is 55 years old. Laura has a bakery business located in her house, where she makes a variety of sweet bread and French bread. Her husband helps her in her business by distributing the bread to stores and neighbors in the area. They have three years of experience in this business, and from month to month, they have improved their sales. Now, they can’t meet the needs of their clients because there is not enough production. Because of this, she is requesting this loan, since she wants to increase her bread production, which will also help her make more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to increase production

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es: Don José de La Cruz Pérez tiene como actividad un taller de soldadura ubicado en su casa de habitación, está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de materiales, además de trabajar en su casa lo hace de manera ambulante. Cuando lo buscan para instalar algún techo u otro trabajo tiene 18 años de trabajar como soldador. Es  padre de 3 hijos los cuales son personas preparadas que con el esfuerzo de sus padres lograron coronar sus carreras. El señor José es un hombre humilde, trabajador y de buenos principios. Pero aun así su mayor sueño es seguir adelante cada día con su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. José de La Cruz Pérez has a welding shop located in his home. He is requesting a loan in order to buy materials, since working in his home can appear less stable. Customers know when they need to install a roof or some other project that José has eighteen years of experience working as a welder.

He is the father of three children, who were prepared to reach their career goals thanks to the effort of their parents. José is a humble man, a hard worker, and of good moral character. His biggest dream is to continue improving his business each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials for his welding business

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Sinceridad Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Sinceridad. Tiene 3 integrantes por lo que cada una de ellas realiza diferentes actividades económicas. En el caso de Lilliam Isidora Pérez R. es casada tiene 58 años y 4 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante. A pesar de edad es una de las mujeres más emprendedoras y dinámicas del grupo.  Su otro socia Aida del Rosario Pérez R. tiene 53 años. Su actividad económica es una tienda de ropa. Ella dio inicio a su negocio con mucho sacrificio y debido a su muy buena administración ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio pues es una mujer muy responsable. Rosa Miriam Pérez R. tiene 56 años. Ellas se han unido con el fin de salir adelante, a pesar de las edades son personas, muy luchadoras y trabajadoras. Por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa. El sueño de las 3 socias es ayudar a sus familias y además que sus hijos aprendan de sus negocios para que esto les ayude a salir adelante para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
The group "Solidario Sinceridad" (Solidarity and Sincerity) has three members, each of whom is involved in different economic activities. Lilliam Isidora Pérez L. is married, 58 years old, and has four children in her care. She sells clothing door-to-door. In spite of her age, she is one of the most entrepreneurial and dynamic women in the group. Another group member is Aida del Rosario Pérez R., who is 53 years old. She has a clothing store. She sacrificed a lot to start this business, and because of her good management she has been successful, and she is a very responsible woman. Rosa Miriam Pérez R. is 56 years old. These women have united with the goal of succeeding. In spite of their ages, they are hard-working, determined women. The purpose of their loan is for capital to buy clothing. The dream of these three women is to help their families, and also for their children to learn about business because this will help them succeed in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es: Eloina cuenta con 41 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos y su esposo es empleado de una lechería. Cuenta con casa propia dotada de todos los servicios básicos. Se dedica a la venta de comidas los fines de semana y adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña venta de abarrotes en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja como encargado en una lechería. Su venta esta medianamente surtida, bien ubicada y con bastante afluencia de clientes, donde la competencia no le afecta porque es la única en la zona. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotes para su tienda.  Ellos son clientes desde el año 2007 con tres créditos en la institución con pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Eloina is 41 years old. She has two children, and her husband is employed by a dairy. She has her own house, which has all the basic services. She sells food on weekends, and also runs a small grocery store in her home, while her husband works at the dairy. Her store is moderately stocked, well-located and has enough customers; she does not have competition because her store is the only one in the area. The purpose of this loan is to buy merchandise for her store. She has been a client since 2007, and has had three loans with this institution and has paid them punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a grocery store

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine D. est une veuve de 65 ans, mère de 8 enfants avec 4 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle veut avec ce prêt renforcer son activité d’embauche porcine, de la vente de boisson et d'un petit commerce. Les revenus générés lui permettront d’assurer une bonne hygiène de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Madeleine D. is a 65-year-old widow and the mother of eight children. And she has four others to support. She wants to use this loan to bolster her business fattening pigs, selling beverages, and running a small business. The generated revenues will enable her to ensure a healthy lifestyle for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising pigs, small-scale commerce, and selling drinks

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander Z. Gómez vive en casa propia con su esposa que se dedica al cuido de sus 3 hijos. La actividad económica de Alexander es venta de semilla de jícaro. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que es un hombre que le gusta su trabajo, ya que se relaciona con muchas personas, y con el tiempo ha logrado aprender muchas cosas relacionadas con su actividad económica. Alexander tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos a comarcas muy lejanas, porque todos sus clientes viven a largas distancias. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de más productos. Su mayor sueño es acondicionar su negocio de una manera formal para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alexander Gómez Z. lives in his own home with his wife, who cares for their three children. He sells semilla de jícaro (a cold vegetable drink). He has been doing this for more than six years. He enjoys his work, since he can meet with many people, and over time he has been able to learn a lot about this economic activity. Alexander has to get up very early to offer his products in other regions, because all of his customers live far from him.

The purpose of this loan is for working capital to buy more products. His greatest dream is to formalize his business for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ernesto Alejandro

texts.es: El joven Ernesto Alejandro B. tiene la actividad económica de un salón de belleza ubicado en su humilde vivienda. Ernesto tiene 23 años de edad. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica brindar el servicio de salón de  belleza. A pesar de la corta edad que tiene ha salido adelante, ya que tenia que hacerse cargo de los gastos de su familia. La única manera que podía lograrlo era dedicándose a brindar el servicio de belleza y así salir adelante debido a sus escasos recursos. Esta solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de materiales, para el negocio es necesario mencionar que el joven es el encargado de hacer peinados, pistoleados, tintes y todo  lo relacionado con la belleza. Su mayor sueño es acondicionar su negocio para que obtener mas clientes.
texts.en:
The young Ernesto Alejandro B. has a beauty salon located in his humble home. Ernesto is 23 years old. He has been providing salon services for more than four years. In spite of his young age, he has been successful, because he had to take care of his family's expenses. The only way he could do that was to provide beauty services, so that he could succeed with few resources.

He is requesting a loan to buy more materials. For his business, he is in charge of styling hair, straightening, dyeing, and everything else related to beauty. His greatest dream is to set up his business to obtain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guadalupe Haydee

texts.es: Guadalupe Haydee G. L. D. S. resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango departamento San Salvador. Guadalupe tiene  54 años D. edad, vive solamente con una hija. La Sra. Guadalupe  tiene un negocio ubicado en su casa es una tienda llamada ‘‘Tienda Haydee’’ venD. productos D. consumo como aceite, gaseosas, sopas entre otros; a pesar que solo lleva tres años desD. que puso su negocio ya posee una clientela estable, la tienda D. Guadalupe ha ido creciendo poco a poco ella pone mucho esmero en su negocio ya que es el único sustento para ella y su hija , ahora Guadalupe solicita un crédito para surtir su tienda así seguir creciendo y mejorando sus ingresos a través D. sus ventas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Haydee G. L. D. S. lives in the city of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Guadalupe is 54 years old and lives alone with her daughter. Ms. Guadalupe runs a store in her home called "Haydee's Store" which sells consumables like oil, soda, and soup among others.

Although she has only had the store for three years she already has an established customer base. Guadalupe's store has grown little by little. She puts a lot of dedication into her business, which is the only source of income for herself and her daughter.

Guadalupe is asking for a loan in order to stock her store as it continues to her grow, to increase her profit through increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her store

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose F., 33 ans, est célibataire avec 2 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite faire de la restauration et en même temps un commerce de fruits. Son objectif est d’assurer son autonomie financière et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Rose F., age 33, is not married and has 2 children to support. She wants to do catering and at the same time commerce in fruits. Her aim is to ensure her financial independance and provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Doing catering and at the same time commerce in fruits

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett del Socorro M. es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Es una mujer casada, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella. Janett es una mujer eficiente pues debido a la alta necesidad de generara ingresos para su familia decide incursionar en este negocio. Ella se dedica a una pulpería hace más de 35 años. Anteriormente su Mama era la que se encargaba del negocio, ubicada en su vivienda. Actualmente al fallecer su Mama decide hacerse cargo de este negocio que ha durado por generaciones. Con este financiamiento podrá comprar gaseosas, jugos, cigarrillos y golosinas en general. Por lo que su deseo es obtener un pequeño restaurante para incrementar un poco sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Janett del Socorro M. is a client of the Fundación León 2000. She is married, and has three children who depend on her. She is an efficient woman, and decided to work at this business because of the need to earn money for her family. She has been working at a grocery store for more than 35 years. Before, her mother was in charge of the business, and it was located inside her home. Now, after her mother's death, Janett decided to take over the business, which has lasted for generations. With this loan, she will be able to buy pop, juice, cigarettes, and candy. Her dream is to start a small restaurant to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús C. B. reside en el departamento de La Paz. Teresa tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien es jornalero y obtiene ingresos de 80$ mensuales y Teresa posee un negocio donde se dedica a la venta  de pollo y cerdo con 4 años de experiencia la Sra. Teresa cuenta con gran demanda en pollo y cerdos los cuales no puede cubrir por falta de dinero es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de pollo y cerdos para luego ser vendidos y obtener un margen de ganancia por los mismo, es importante mencionar que Teresa ya ha manejado créditos anteriormente los cuales tiene cancelados y fue muy puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús C. B. lives in the department of La Paz. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband who is a day laborer and makes about $80 a month. Teresa has a business where she sells chickens and pigs. She has been doing this for four years and while there is great demand for her chicken and pigs, it does not make up for their lack of income.

For this reason she is asking for a loan in order to buy more chicken and pigs to be sold later to obtain a profit by it. It is important to mention that Teresa has handled loans before which have all been paid off and she is punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: La señora Claudia Maria L. A. tiene 37 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en comarcas. Es madre de 2 hijos una niña de 16 años y un niño de 7 años de edad.  Su esposo trabaja en una finca ubicada en las afueras de la ciudad. Doña Claudia tiene 10 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos a la gente del campo ya que ellos son sus principales clientes debido a que por falta de tiempo ellos no pueden venir a la ciudad a realizar sus compras. Claudia ha trabajado muy duro para mantener este negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas y ropa interior. Su mayor sueño es sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria is 37 years old and works as a regional street vendor selling clothing. She is the mother of a 16-year-old daughter and a 7-year-old son. Her husband works on a farm located on the outskirts of the city. Claudia has been selling clothing for 10 years to rural customers, who have become her primary clients due to the fact that because they don’t have time they are unable to come to the city to do their shopping. Claudia has worked very hard to maintain this business since it is her only source of income. She requests a loan for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, and underwear. Her greatest dream is for her children to successfully complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es: José Ricardo H. A. reside en el municipio Rosario de La Paz departamento  La Paz. José tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su  esposa Luz y su hijo José de 7 años de edad estudiante de 2º grado. José posee su propio negocio donde se dedica a la producción de muebles como camas, comedor, sofás y otros; con 6 años de experiencia en esta actividad ahora le permite a José ser muy conocido en la zona y distribuir sus muebles en varias comerciales y  también tiene clientes que lo buscan directamente; los precios que José ofrece son muy competitivos es por eso el éxito que ha tenido a través de sus ventas, ahora José solicita un crédito para materiales utilizados en la elaboración de muebles ya que no alcanza a cubrir la producción demandada por sus clientes, con este crédito José podrá trabaja más, lo que le ayudara a mejorar sus ganancias que son necesarias para él y su familia.
texts.en:
José Ricardo H. A. lives in the city of Rosario de La Paz in the department of La Paz. Jose is 30 years old, lives with his wife Luz, and his 7 year old son José who is in second grade.

José has his own business where he makes furniture like beds, sofas, dining room tables, and others. He has six years of experience in this trade, which means José is very knowledgeable about the area and distributes his furniture in various stores in addition to having clients he deals with directly. José offers very competitive prices which is why he sees such success in his sales.

José is asking for a loan to buy materials he uses in the production of his furniture, because currently he cannot meet the production demand of his clients. With this loan José will be able to work more, which will help increase the earnings that are necessary for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materiels for furniture making

loans.name: Rose A

texts.fr: Rose A. F. est une dame mariée de 60 ans, avec un enfant en charge. Elle souhaiterait augmenter son capital d’embauche porcine. Elle s’active aussi dans l’aviculture et le petit commerce. Son objectif est de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Rose A. F. is a 60-year-old married woman, with a child to support. She would like to increase her capital for fattening pigs. She is also engaged in poultry farming and petty trading. Her aim is to contribute to the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Doing business in fattening pigs, poultry farming and petty trading

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Don Rafael es cliente nuevo, fue recomendado por una cliente, que esta en su primera secuencia y que hasta el momento jamas se atraso ni un solo dia.  La actividad economica que realiza el cliente es arreglo y confecciones de prendas de vestir esta actividad la realiza en un pequeño taller en  el populoso mercado Rodriguez.  Vive con su mama y  sus hermanos pero los fines de semana se va a cuidar a su abuelo, ademas de la costura don Rafael estudia por las noches.  El cliente invertira el dinero del prestamo en la compra de una Maquina  Oberlock para poder tambien areglar prendas mas gruesas.
texts.en:
Rafael is a new client. He was recommended by another client who is in his first loan cycle. Up until now he has never been late, not even one day. Rafael makes clothing. He does this in a small shop in the heavily populated Rodriguez market. He lives with his mother and his siblings. On the week ends he goes to take care of his grandfather. In addition to sewing, Rafael goes to school in the evenings. He will use the money from the loan to buy an Overlock sewing machine to be able to make thicker clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and Overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario Antonio M. Sáenz tiene 54 años. Tiene la actividad económica de taller de carpintería. Hace más de 33 años que se dedica este negocio. Mario dio inicio desde muy joven a esta actividad. Por lo que tenía una familia que necesitaba de ingresos. Mario siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable, y le ha gustado ganarse el dinero de una manera muy decente y trabajadora. El financiamiento solicitado es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como madera, broca, cepillos, destornillador, escuadras y martillos entre otras cosas. El sueño es mantener esta actividad económica para seguirle proporcionando a su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Antonio M. Sáenz is 54. He has a carpentry shop. He has been in this business for over 33 years. He started this business when he was very young. He had a family that needed income. Mario has always been a very responsible man. He has enjoyed earning money in a decent way by working hard. He is asking for a loan for working capital to buy raw materials like wood, a drill bit, brushes, screwdriver, set squares, and hammers, among other things. His dream is to keep this business to keep providing his family with their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: Sylvie B. est âgée de 34 ans, célibataire. Elle s’active dans l’élevage porcin, l’aviculture et le petit commerce. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital d’investissement pour s’assurer une meilleure condition de vie.
texts.en:
Sylvie B., age 34, is unmarried. She is engaged in pig framing, poultry farming and petty trading.This loan will enable her to bolster her capital investment in order to ensure a better living condition.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Doing pig farming, poutry farming and petty trading

loans.name: Martha Ryder

texts.es: Martha Ryder Ramírez R. tiene la edad de 35 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. Martha dio inicio a su negocio hace más de 3 años. Por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles, anteriormente Martha se dedicaba a brindar el servicio de costura, pero no pudo seguir manteniendo este negocio, además con lo que ganaba no era suficiente para mantener a sus hijos, es así que decide incursionar en esta actividad económica con el fin de obtener más ingresos. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pan y golosinas en general. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martha Ryder Ramírez R. is 35, married, and has two dependent children. Martha started her business over three years ago. In the beginning, it was very difficult. Martha previously worked as a seamstress. But, she could not maintain this business. Also, she did not earn enough to support her children. She decided to start a new economic activity to get more income. The loan is for working capital to buy juice, soft drinks, natural drinks, bread, and general sweets. Her biggest wish is for her children to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar Armando G. C. reside en el cantón El Izcatal en el departamento de Cabañas,  A sus 38 años de edad Oscar vive con su madre y sus dos hermanos Santos de 23 años y Guillermo de 33 años quien es agricultor. Oscar posee su negocio con cinco años  de experiencia se dedica a la venta de oro, zapatos  perfumes de manera ambulante, el viaja a diferentes pueblos de Cabañas ofreciendo sus productos, los ingresos que obtiene Oscar son para ayudar a la manutención de su madre con sus hermanos, Oscar solita un crédito porque  desea comprar mayor cantidad de sus productos, de esta manera el tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Oscar Armando G. C. lives in the district of El Izcatal in the department of Cabañas. Oscar is 38 years old and lives with his mother and two brothers, Santos who is 23 and Guillermo who is 33 and a farm worker.

Oscar has a business that he has had for five years peddling gold, shoes, and perfumes. He travels to different towns in Cabañas offering his products. Oscar's earnings help financially support his mother and brothers.

Oscar is asking for a loan because he wants to buy a greater quantity of products to increase his potential to augment sales and therefore his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela G. O. reside en Rosario de La Paz departamento de  La Paz. A sus  41 años de edad es una madre soltera con 4 hijos aun menores de edad. Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora y sonriente lo cual la ha sacado adelante y ver la vida con una manera entusiasta y es así como ella maneja su negocio con energía la cual hace que sus clientes la prefieran en el mercado municipal, con doce años de experiencia en el negocio sus ventas son estables y muy buenas, es por eso que Ángela solicita un crédito ya que sus ventas aumentan y ella quiere  comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para su comida, de esta manera lograra obtener mayores ingresos que son de gran utilidad para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela G. O. lives in Rosario de La Paz in the La Paz department. She is 41, a single mother, and has four minor children. Ángela is a hard working, cheerful woman. This has helped her get ahead and view life enthusiastically. That is how she energetically runs her business, and it makes her customers prefer her over other vendors in the municipal market. She has 12 years of experience in the business. Her sales are very good and stable. That is why Ángela is asking for a loan. Her sales are increasing, and she wants to buy a larger quantity of raw materials for her food. This way she will get greater earnings, which are extremely useful to her and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Thérèse
